title: These Sisters Are Serving Authentic, Homely Andhra Flavours! CURRYCE ANDHRA BHOJANAM, Bengaluru
description:
#curryceandhrabhojanam #andhracuisine #bangalore

curryce andhra bhojanam, andhra restaurant, rt nagar, north bangalore, bengaluru, vegetarian andhra bhojanam, andhra food, andhra thali, chicken gongura, kodi vepudu, royulu roast, pappu, majjiga pulusu, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, popular restaurant, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

Sisters Chandrakala and Shoba were running a successful catering business which was unfortunately brought down by the pandemic. They lay low for 27 months before bouncing back with a small eatery to serve up Andhra delicacies made to the recipes of their parents and grandparents. Curryce Andhra Bhojanam, located in RT Nagar, North Bengaluru is only four tables large, but in my opinion, the food that they serve is destined for bigger things ahead. Join me in this homely episode where I taste a full-fledged veg bhojanam, kodi vepudu, gongura chicken royulu roast and a memorable Hyderabadi style biryani.

Please do your best to support tiny small businesses like these that need all the help that they can get for the delicious work they do. Hope you enjoy this one; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Is This Bengaluru’s Most Underrated Dosae? CHALUKYA SAMRAT Unique Dosa Making! MINI SAMRAT CHALUKYA
description:
#chalukyasamrat #masaladosa #bangalore

chalukya samrat, mini samrat chalukya, millers road, bengaluru, chalukya samrat hotel, ghee roast dosae, ghee roast dosa, masala dosae, badam halwa, coffee, south indian tiffin, vegetarian, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, popular restaurant, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

In this episode, I seek out a dosae memory from 20 years ago! A unique reddish-orange-hued dosae that found its home in the erstwhile Samrat restaurant at Chalukya Hotel, Bengaluru. Sadly, the place closed its doors a few months ago, however second generation restaurateur, Santosh Shanbag is committed to preserving the near 50-year-old culinary legacy of his father. I caught up with him and also a masterclass in the technique that goes into the making of their signature Chalukya Samrat ghee roast dosae. 

Hope you enjoy this one. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Ghee Roast Masala Dosae
Rs. 90
9/10

Badam Halwa
Rs. 75
8/10

Coffee
Rs. 12
7/10

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Kripal Amanna
Gourmet On The Road & Founder, Food Lovers TV


Mini Samrat Chalukya, Millers Road, Next to Ambedkar Bhavan, Vasanth Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560052; tel +91 94838 54321  
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/AVgXY6bCYwqyXD2w7    
Timings: 7am to 1030pm
Note: Due to its unique cooking process, each Chalukya Samrat ghee roast dosae takes about 15 minutes to be prepared, and longer if there's a rush. Kindly support the restaurant with your patience.

title: Bengaluru’s Famous But Hidden CHANDRAPPA HOTEL! 46 Years Of Non Vegetarian Tradition! Must Try!
description:
#chandrappahotel #nonvegetarian #bangalore

chandrappa hotel, mathikere, old but unknown eatery, north bengaluru, military hotel, non vegetarian eatery, mutton chops, mutton curry, brain pepper fry, pork pepper fry, pork garlic dry, mutton biryani, rasam, akki roti, ragi mudde, guntur chicken, local cuisine, chandrappa hotel mathikere, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, popular restaurant, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

When Mr. Chandrappa moved to Mathikere, then a remote corner of Bengaluru nearly half a century ago, he set up a vegetarian eatery to cater to the local populace. This met with limited success, however things clicked when he added in the non vegetarian dishes that he and his wife would cook at home. Eventually, his sons joined in to support this family enterprise that in a span of 46 years has come to be the de facto eatery for naati (local style) non-vegetarian oota in the area. However, there are still many outside the immediate area who are yet to discover the homely taste of the fare here. I was one of them, until I paid a surprise visit one afternoon. In doing so, I caught up with the second and third generation of Chandrappa’s family and also his culinary legacy in a smorgasbord of meaty dishes.

Hope you enjoy this one. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: This Vada Pav Seller Makes A Secret, Spicy Chutney That His Father Taught Him! MODERN VADA PAV
description:
#streetfood #vadapav #bengaluru

modern vada pav, btm 2nd stage, south bangalore, bengaluru, vada pav, bread pakoda, mumbai vada pav, butter vada pav, cheese vada pav, jp nagar, bengaluru, vegetarian, snacks, tiffin, south bengaluru, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

After completing his education, Kamalesh Gowda decided to put up a vada pav stall and deploy his father’s recipe of a spicy chutney that the latter had picked up during his days in Mumbai decades ago. Tucked in a quiet bylane of BTM 2nd Stage in South Bengaluru, one-man army, Kamlesh goes about his business quietly, particular about his ingredients resulting in his regular customers being quite vocal for him. Which is how I discovered him through a twitter poll a few weeks ago. Please do support small enterprises like Modern Vada Pav Centre that are trying to earn an honest living serving delicious fare.

I hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Have You Tried Coconut Shell Idli, Jackfruit Leaf Idli? New JAGLI TINDI | Kadubu, Khara Buns, Halbai
description:
#jaglitindi #vegetarian #bengaluru

jagli tindi, jp nagar, bengaluru, vegetarian, tiffin, south indian, kotte kadubu, idli, coco shell idli, sambar, chutney, mangalore buns, khara buns, ragi halbai, coffee, traditional vegetarian snacks from south canara, south bengaluru, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

The last few months I’ve been travelling a bit and so have missed some of my favourite dishes from namma ooru. In this short vlog, I reacquaint my taste buds with the comforting joy of an idli in the kotte kadubu and an unusual coconut shell-steamed idli at the new outpost of Jagli Tindi a passion enterprise committed to showcasing dakshina kannada’s tiffin thindi. description:
#taufiqbiryani #bestbiryani #jamamasjid

In our last Old Delhi outing this season, we stumbled upon the best biryani that we tasted in the walled city. Getting to Taufiq Dilpasand Biryani Point requires some effort given its location in the inner recesses of Galli Haveli Azam Khan, a bit of a walk from Jama Masjid. The shop itself is a little more than a window, but the biryani that emerges from the copper pots here has endeared itself to biryani lovers in the know for a quarter of a century now. Hope you enjoy this one too.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Delhi’s Best Chicken Fry At HAJI MOHD HUSSAIN, Amazing Nahari At SHABRATI | Old Delhi Food Tour Ep 9
description:
#hajimohammadhussainchickenfry #shabratinahari #jamamasjid

purani delhi, old delhi, non vegetarian, food tour, jama masjid, haji mohd hussain fried chicken, haji mohammad hussain chicken, haji mohammad hussain chicken fry, fried chicken of old delhi, delhi jama masjid chicken fry, chicken fry old delhi, shabrati nahari shop, shabrati nihari wale, shabrati nahari centre, purani dilli ki asli nahari, old delhi nahari, mohabbat ka sharbat, delhi food walk, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

They call Haji Mohd Hussain’s fried chicken the KFC of Old Delhi, a moniker well earned by the hard working septuagenarian for his single minded focus to making his version of a double fried, crisp and juicy, spicy chicken. Speaking of one-dish eateries, further down the road, one also finds Shabrati Nahari Shop that has been making a slow-braised eight-hour nahari twice a day each day since 1954. And in between the fried chicken and nahari, I also gulped down a few glasses of mohabbat ka sharbat, a delightful refreshing concoction that I instantly fell in love with. 

Hope you love this episode too. Subscribe and hit the bell to stay tuned for a couple more in our Old Delhi series. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Delhi’s Most Famous ASLAM BUTTER CHICKEN, Tea At SALEEM STALL | Old Delhi Food Tour Ep 8
description:
#aslamchicken #saleemteastall #delhifoodwalk

purani delhi, old delhi, non vegetarian, food tour, jama masjid, aslam chicken, aslam butter chicken, butter chicken, aslam chicken old delhi, aslam chicken jama masjid, aslam chicken tikka, saleem tea stall, saleem tea, delhi food walk, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

Park aside whatever notions you may have of the butter chicken, for Purani Dilli’s most famous Aslam Butter Chicken is anything but that. Made to a seemingly simple recipe with secret masalas, this roasted and charcoal grilled chicken bathed in copious amounts of molten butter has built for this Jama Masjid eatery an iconic status over a span of 25 years. We catch the making of this indulgent chicken tikka, but before that take respite in the reinvigorating offerings of a tea stall that goes back seven or eight decades. 

Hope you enjoy this episode. Subscribe and hit the bell to stay tuned for a couple more in our Old Delhi series. Take care; stay safe and strong. 

Happy eating!

Saleem’s Tea Stall

Aslam Butter Chicken

8.5/10

title: AVAREBELE MELA 2023 With Sudha Murthy, Sihi Kahi Chandru | 23 Year Festival Shree Vasavi Condiments
description:
#avarebelemela #shreevasavicondiments #bengaluru 

avarebele mela, avarekai festival, culinary festival, shree vasavi avarebele mela, shree vasavi condiments, annual festival, bengaluru festival, bangalore, karnataka, street food, avarebele snacks, avarebele chikki, avarebele vada, avarebele dosae, avarebele sweets, mysore pak, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

What began as Mrs. Geetha Shivakumar’s home cooking initiative 23 years ago to bridge with farmers and bring a seasonal produce to Bengaluru’s consumers in a myriad range of savoury and sweet delicacies is now a culinary institution called the Avarebele Mela. Farmers congregate from Magadi, Karnataka bringing the pick of their crops and the cooks from Shree Vasavi Condiments cook up a host of preparations, each one featuring the avarebele. I was recently invited to open this festival with a host of other dignitaries including Mrs. Sudha Murthy, Sihi Kahi Chandru Sir and others. Hope you enjoy this vlog account of my experience there. The mela runs through 9th January 2023 at National College Grounds, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Link to previous Avarebele Festival video:
Exploring BANGALORE’S  Tasty AVAREBELE FESTIVAL| VV PURAM FOOD STREET |Avarebele Vada, Dosa, Jalebi! https://youtu.be/xxTaQDRJpSQ 

Note: The Avarebele Festival is held in January each year, this edition runs at National College Grounds ( https://goo.gl/maps/LUSiX2xhzDGeRGmeA ) until 9th January 2023. After the festival, you will find some of the avarebele delicacies at Sri Vasavi Condiments (address below).

title: Tasting Changezi Chicken, Biryani & Kebab At AL JAWAHAR, Shahi Sheermal | Old Delhi Food Tour Ep 7
description:
#aljawaharhotel #jamamasjid #delhifoodwalk

purani delhi, old delhi, non vegetarian, food tour, chandni chowk, al jawahar restaurant old delhi, al jawahar restaurant jama masjid, al jawahar hotel, jama masjid kabab, matia mahal road, delhi 6, seekh kabab, chicken changezi, mutton, seekh kebab, mutton biryani, shahi sheermal, haji nizamuddin shahi sheermal, delhi food walk, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

That the Changezi chicken was created as an ode to a Mongol invader may be folklore, but we definitely found in this ‘roasted chicken in gravy’ a dish that conquered our palates at Al Jawahar, a fabled eatery near Jama Masjid, Old Delhi. Alongside other Mughlai fare, we also tasted a unique Shahi Sheermal, a rich, fortified bread cooked in a tandoor at Haji Nizamuddin. 

Hope you enjoy this episode. Subscribe and hit the bell to stay tuned for more in our Old Delhi series. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Masala Dosae, Bisi Bele Bath With Rocky Singh | Has Food Changed? Eating Food Your Grandma Knew!
description:
#rockyandmayur #kripalamanna #foodloverstv

rocky singh, mayur sharma, road trippin with rocky, rocky and mayur, food and travel show, history tv 18, rocky and mayur highway on my plate, highway on my plate, road trippin with rocky, bengaluru, karnataka, mavalli tiffin rooms, mtr, lalbagh, bengaluru, bangalore, breakfast, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food, food vlogging, food reviews, how to, food vlogs

In the second part of my Mavalli Tiffin Rooms morning with the inimitable Rocky Singh, we touch upon some important aspects of food that we take for granted especially at legacy eateries. title: Tasting Old Delhi’s Most Famous Pure Fruit Kulfi Since 1906! KUREMAL MAHAVIR PRASAD | Food Tour Ep 5
description:
#delhi #kuremalkulfiwale #chandnichowk

purani delhi, old delhi,vegetarian, food tour, chandni chowk, kuremal mahavir prasad kulfi wale, kuremal kulfi wale, pure fruit kulfi, mango kulfi, jamun kulfi, anaar kulfi, pomegranate, jamun kulfi, dessert, ice cream, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

Our last stop on an epic Delhi 6 vegetarian food tour features Kuremal Mahavir Prasad Kulfi Wale, a tiny shop that is perhaps Purani Dilli’s most famous dessert stop. Picture whole mangoes, apples, oranges, pomegranate set with pure fruit kulfi, and also a bevy of traditional fruits like jamun, phalsa, tamarind, et al hand-churned into tantalising, chatpata granitas and sorbets. That’s what draws customers here for over 115 years!

Stay tuned for the Jama Masjid, Old Delhi food tour coming up next, subscribe to stay tuned, Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Tasting GIANI’S DI HATTI Most Popular Chole, Rabri Falooda & Lassi! Old Delhi Food Tour Ep 4
description:
#delhi #gianidihatti #chandnichowk

purani delhi, old delhi, vegetarian,  food tour, chandni chowk, giani’s di hatti, chole bhature, chole chawal, chana chawal, rabri falooda, faluda, giani ice cream, lassi, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

Established in 1956, Giani’s Di Hatti is a legendary Old Delhi institution for its chole bhature, chana chawal, rabri falooda, malai lassi, among other offerings. Tended to by the third generation of a family that migrated to Delhi post partition, the old fashioned fare here is the sort that endears to locals for its wholesome goodness laced with a tinge of nostalgia. When in Chandni Chowk, Giani’s Di Hatti is a definite must-visit. 

Hope you are enjoying our Old Delhi series. Plenty more coming up, subscribe to stay tuned, Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Old Delhi Most Popular Street Food! Padam Chaat, Lotan Chole Kulche, Hazari Lal Khurchan | Ep 2
description:
#delhi #chandnichowk #vegetarian

purani delhi, old delhi, food tour, chandni chowk, hazari lal jain khurchan wale, lotan chole kulche, padam chaat corner,  khurchan, khurchan roll, badam milk, chole kulche, golgappa, kalmi vada, paani puri, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

In this sweet and savoury episode, we cover three must-visit Old Delhi favourites. Our first stop is at Hazari lal Jain Khurchan Wale where we taste the pure dairy goodness of a traditional reduced milk dessert and some more. This is followed by a piquant introduction to Old Delhi’s famous Lotan Chole Kulche. This is perhaps the spiciest chole that I have tasted, and the reason, I am told, for its popularity especially in Delhi’s nippy winters. Our last halt, Padam Chaat comes as a wonderful respite for its tantalizing chaats that work marvelously well to tease our taste buds with a broad array of textures and delicate flavours. 

Hope you enjoy this one too, lots more coming up in this exciting food tour. Subscribe to stay tuned, Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Old Delhi Best Street Food Tour Ep 1 | Old Famous Jalebi, Paranthe Wali Galli | Chandni Chowk
description:
#delhi #chandnichowk #vegetarian

purani delhi, old delhi, food tour, chandni chowk, old and famous jalebi, jalebi rabri, ghee jalebi, larantha chowk, paranthe wali galli, parantha, paratha, papad parantha, green peas parantha, mixed parantha, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

Hi folks, welcome to our first Delhi food tour, where I team up with my good friend, Chef Amit Wadhawan to relish and bring to you the enormous array of delicacies that the narrow alleys of Old Delhi have to offer. In the first few episodes, we explore a gamut of vegetarian street fare, beginning with two iconic eateries that date back to the close of the nineteenth century. One serves a scrumptious ghee soaked jalebi with thick rabri, and the other revels in its incredible variety of paranthas, that are decadently fried in pure desi ghee.

Hope you enjoy this one, lots more coming up in this exciting food tour. Subscribe to stay tuned, Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: SURYAWANSHI, A Family’s Devotion to True MAHARASHTRIAN Food | Throwback
description:
#suryawanshi #maharashtriancuisine #bengaluru

Authentic Maharashtrian Food at Suryawanshi Restaurant, Bengaluru, Bangalore, Kolhapuri Mutton, Mutton Thali, Pune Vegetarian Food, Pandra Rasa, Tamba Rasa, Misal pav, Vada Pav, Sabudana Vada, Whitefield, Bangalore, Prawn Fry, Pomfret Fry, Malvan Fish Curry, eating out in bengaluru, bangalore,  food trail, must try restaurant 

When Kailash Suryawanshi moved from Kolhapur to Bengaluru with his family nearly a decade ago, the one cuisine he couldn’t get any of was his own. Such was his yearning for food from his land, that this entrepreneur decided to take upon himself the onerous task of introducing Bengaluru to authentic Marathi fare. After months of travel through the hinterlands of Maharashtra, gleaning recipes and cooks, Suryawanshi was born, a restaurant where conversations in Marathi waft through the dining room, as if in endorsement of the food served here.

In this throwback #gourmetontheroad episode, I catch up with the Suryawanshi family and also tuck into some delicious Maharashtrian cuisine, tasting everything from Pandra Aani Tambda Rasa, Misal Pav, Sabudana Vada, Puneri Veg Thali, Kolhaprui Mutton Thali, Puran Poli, Amras, Shrikhand and more. Enjoy!

A restaurant that has been in existence since 1958, Mangala Vilas in Salem is known for its entirely non-vegetarian menu that features homestyle dishes made using spice blends ground fresh every day. 

In this throwback episode, we visit their relatively newer, 15-year-old outlet of Mangala Vilas on New Bus Stand Road Salem to savour a hardcore robustly flavoured non-vegetarian feast! 

Before getting to the table, we step inside the kitchen to watch the making of the signature Mangala masala that is used in the making of every dish on the restaurant’s menu. title: Tasting The Mumbai PAV BHAJI At SHIV SAGAR Bengaluru! Throwback
description:
#shivsagar #pavbhaji #bangalore

shiv sagar, mumbai pav bhaji, bengaluru, pav bhaji making, vegetarian restaurant, eating out in bangalore, bengaluru food trail, vegetarian, popular restaurant

A dish that finds its origins in leftover vegetables tossed by street vendors into an inexpensive but tasty mash and served with local bakery bread as cheap sustenance to Bombay’s mill workers at the turn of the last century, the pav bhaji evolved to its buttery, cheesy, somewhat indulgent avatar courtesy savvy restaurateurs in the seventies and eighties. My memories of a Mumbai pav bhaji go back to Shiv Sagar, Juhu and Vile Parle, a hop and a skip away from college, where I relished many a plate. So when a craving for the Mumbai style pav bhaji hit me one cold evening, I found my way to the Bengaluru outpost of Shiv Sagar, where brothers Ram and Shyam, second generation restaurateurs trained in the Mumbai restaurant, dish up this quintessential Mumbai fast food that is quite close to the real deal. 

Hope you enjoy this throwback episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

title: Massive 18-DISH SEAFOOD LUNCH In Kerala! Samudra Sadhya At HOTEL AMBIKA, Calicut | Throwback
description:
#seafoodsadya #ambikahotel #calicut

ambika hotel, kozhikode, seafood feast, seafood sadya, best seafood offering, calicut food tour, must try restaurant in calicut, kozhikode best restaurants, kerala, eating out in kozhikode, calicut food tour

If you love your seafood, Ambhika Hotel in Kozhikode is where you have to be for their legendary seafood sadhya that serves up over 18 varieties on a banana leaf. From pickles to chutneys to porichatu, peera, avial, pulisherry, aviyal, curries, kappa to even the sambar and rasam, every sadhya staple is made in a seafood version! Kingfish, prawns, crabs, squid, sardines, pomfret, mussels, silverfish… there’s every conceivable marine form on offer on the banana leaf.

In this throwback episode, I savoured their super sumptuous lunch and also indulged in a couple of their legendary fish fries.

Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

title: Famous AHMEDIA VANIYAMBADI BIRYANI New 250-seat Restaurant On Bengaluru Chennai Highway! Must-Try!
description:
ahmedia restaurant, nh 48, highway, ahmedia hotel, vaniyambadi, best mutton biryani, chicken biryani, mutton nalli soup, paya, mutton dishes, vaniyambadi cuisine, mutton bheja fry, brain pepper fry, kaleji fry, gurda fry, liver, kidney pepper fry, parotta, mutton kheema, highway restaurant, highway stop, bengaluru chennai highway, best non vegetarian restaurant on highway, vaniyambadi biryani, ahmedia hotel, must try restaurant, tamil nadu food tour, eating out in vaniyambadi, eateries in vaniyambadi, support local
 
47 years ago, Janab Ahmed Basha Sahib set up a modest eatery in Vaniyambadi, a town in Tirupattur district of Tamil Nadu, famous for its leather industry. The fare at Ahmedia Hotel was mostly Mughlai,  inspired by the culinary traditions of erstwhile North Arcot principality. Over decades the kitchens here have perfected time-honored recipes, amongst them a wood-fire-cooked biryani that, unusual for Tamil Nadu, favours the basmati over seeraga samba rice. I discovered Ahmedia three years ago on a #gourmetontheroad tour through the region when I met the founder and his enterprising sons. Janab Ahmed Basha has passed on since, but his sons seem determined to build on their father’s legacy. And have now opened a massive 25,000 sq. ft., 250-seat Ahmedia branch on the Bengaluru Chennai highway with the conveniences required to cater to travellers. I visited them on a recent trip to Chennai, where I tasted most of my favourite dishes here, including the biryani that has put Vaniyambadi on the culinary map.

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: South India’s Biggest Sweets & Snacks Factory! ADYAR ANANDA BHAVAN | A2B Pure Ghee Sweets Making Pt1
description:
#adyaranandabhavan #a2b #sweetsfactorytour

adyar ananda bhavan, a2b, south india’s largest restaurant and sweets chain, family run, adyar ananda bhavan factory tour, a2b food factory tour, 100% vegetarian, pure ghee sweets, snacks, kaju katli, kaju katli making, dodda burfi, jangiri, jangiri making, mysore pak, mysore pak making, chennai, bengaluru, tamil nadu, karnataka, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

I recently received an invitation that compelled me to drive 350 kilometres to visit the Adyar Ananda Bhavan Sweets & Snacks Factory in Ambattur, Chennai. A2B, as the group is popularly known, is now perhaps South India’s most recognised restaurant, sweets and snacks brand, with over 150 outlets across Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, and overseas, however its origins are rather humble and trace an agricultural family’s inspiring 60-year journey through Rajapalyam, Bengaluru, Chennai and beyond. As I learnt from the second and third generation of the Adyar Ananda Bhavan family when I visited their facility that can produce over 40,000 kilos of savouries and 10,000 kilos of sweets evry single day! 

What is heartening though is the family’s commitment to sourcing quality ingredients, even making their own ghee to ensure 100% purity, and fostering an environment where the skill and craft involved in making artisanal handmade sweets is also encouraged alongside automated production lines to meet the burgeoning demand for their sweets and savouries. I hope you enjoy the first part of this very special episode this Deepavali weekend.

Happy Diwali! Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

title: Nearly 100 Years, UDUPI SRI KRISHNA BHAVAN Is Bengaluru’s Best Kept Secret! Sagu Dosae, Best Sambar
description:
#udupisrikrishnabhavan #balepete #bangalore

pure vegetarian restaurant, oldest restaurant, bengaluru, south canara cuisine, sambar, rava idli, vada, vade, sagu dosae, masala dosa, south indian tiffin, dumrot, badam halwa, gulab jamun, filter coffee, popular bengaluru restaurants, balepet, chickpet, must try restaurant, historical restaurant, heritage eatery, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, vegetarian, eateries in bangalore, support local

Although established at its present location in 1926, its culinary provenance dates back to the early 1900s. One of Bengaluru’s oldest eateries, Udupi Sri Krishna Bhavan has not received the kind of recognition other eateries of its ilk have perhaps due to its location amidst the hustle and bustle of Balepete. The food here is prepared the old-fashioned way, not the sort that swims in rivers of ghee or is buried under mounds of butter, khoa, or other such dairy decadence. Which is good, especially if you want to indulge, sans any guilt, in its tasty South Canara fare, like many of its regular patrons, some who have been visiting for 50 years! I soak in some charming old-world vibe as I make a tasty meal of some of their must-try dishes including a scrumptious, very popular sagu dosae and perhaps the most impressionable sambar you will find in this city. A sambar that we also watched the making of. 
Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

I chanced upon this small shop tucked in a by-lane of Indiranagar, serving the hitherto unseen (in Bengaluru) flavours of Benares, Uttar Pradesh. In this quick evening stop, I made quick work of some of the must-try dishes on their menu, scrumptious samosas, a weighty, comforting dal and methi (fenugreek) poori, aloo mangodi, fresh ghee jalebis, an utterly 'khasta' kachori and more. If you love the vegetarian flavours of the North, especially UP, Panditji Ras Bana Rahe is a must-visit. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: This AMMA Began A Street Food Pizza Van To Survive Lockdown! AMMA’S ITALIAN PIZZAs With Spicy Punch!
description:
#streetfood #bengaluru #pizza 

amma’s italian pizza, vegetarian, flavourful pizzas, spicy, koramangala, bengaluru, south bengaluru, delicious pizzas, margherita pizza, karnataka pizza, fresh pizzas, bangalore, street food, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, roadside eateries in bangalore, support local, support small business

When Mrs. Padma and her husband, Prakash mulled the idea of a new street food enterprise in the throes of the pandemic to stay afloat, they thought it would be unique to introduce the pizza but in a flavourful avatar that would resonate the punchy flavours that people expect in street fare. And thus was born Amma’s Italian Pizza, first on a cart and now a van. Padma Amma experimented with vegetarian topping combinations for days on end at her home, also sharpening her secret recipe for a piquant pizza sauce, a sprightly medley of herbs, spices, sour, sweet and heat. From a spiced-up Margherita to a Karnataka pizza that basically incorporates almost every ingredient she has available, Amma’s pizzas are slowly but surely gaining favour with the locals of Koramangala, South Bengaluru for her hygienic approach to using fresh quality ingredients and creating flavours of the sort that appeal to most mainstream palates. The name may say ‘Italian’, but these are the sort of pizzas that resonate the ‘kadak’, street vibes of namma ooru, Bengaluru.

title: Found This Hidden 36-Year-Old Village Style Eatery! RAJANNA MILITARY HOTEL, Best Mutton Kaima, Kurma
description:
#rajannaamilitaryhotel #villagefood #bangalore

rajanna military hotel, magadi road, vijayanagar, village style eatery, naati oota, kaima unde, mutton mince balls, mutton kurma, sambar, boti, west bengaluru, bangalore, west bangalore, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, support local, support small business

After picking up recipes from a stint in a Maratha military hotel kitchen in Bengaluru, Rajanna, a native of Kunigal, began serving non vegetarian meals in a small shed off Magadi Road in Vijayanagar 36 years ago. The menu comprised only nine items, mostly mutton, cooked by Rajanna himself with a single masala that would be ground by him at home. He passed on shortly after, but his wife and brother in law have continued his work over decades, preserving the flavour and character of the food. From a shed, it is now a tiny eatery, sans any name board, where customers queue up for rustic, village style fare served on banana leaves off granite slabs that serve as benches and tables. A recent addition also includes a basic but functional family room. I caught up with my chef friend, Sushil Dwarkanath to explore the cooking here and also make a tasty meal of their mutton delicacies. If you love meaty, rustic flavours, this is the place to savour it. 

Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Left WIth No Jobs This Couple Began An All-Women REDDY MANE BIRYANI To Serve Food At Honest Prices!
description:
#reddymanebiryanirestaurant #biryani #bangalore

reddy mane biryani, non vegetarian food, small business, homely biryani, biryani, chicken biryani, mutton biryani, chicken kebab, karivepaku chicken, mutton kaima vade, mutton kaima gojju, mutton fry, vidyaranyapura, north bengaluru, bangalore, north bangalore, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, support local, support small business

When Gautham Reddy, a DJ, and his wife, Christine, a pastry chef, suddenly found themselves out of work due to the pandemic, they put together their savings into a culinary enterprise, a café, that met with limited success. Lesson learnt, they turned next to a home delivery business focused on non vegetarian fare derived from family recipes. Orders followed, giving them the confidence to set up a tiny eatery in the suburb of Vidyaranyapura. Things have been slow though, and when they reached out to us to help spread the word, we stepped in for a surprise visit one Wednesday afternoon. Manned by an all-women team, the fare here is the sort that is homely, tasty and most importantly, honestly priced. We tasted around 10 dishes, the sort that would happily feed a hungry party of four, and worked up a bill of just over Rs. 1200. I hope you have the heart to support enterprises like these that are committed to honest work, and trying to do their best to stay afloat in these trying times.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: This Tiny, Hidden 30-Year-Old PUNJABI PURE VEG Serves Honestly Priced Amritsari Khaana In Bengaluru!
description:
#punjabifood #chickpet #bangalore

punjabi pure veg restaurant, chickept, balepet, bengaluru, amritsari cuisine, vegetarian punjabi food in bengaluru, bangalore, dal makhani, yellow dal, paneer patiala, bhindi subzi, amritsari naan, laccha paratha, tandoori kheer, gulab jamun, south bangalore, street food, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, vegetarian, eateries in bangalore, support local, support small business

Over 30 years ago, Dinesh Sood and his brother Deepak Sood, originally from Ludhiana, set up a tiny four-table eatery in the old market area of Balepet, Bengaluru to serve North Indian khaana to traders and travellers who would visit the area. Gaining popularity over time, Punjabi Pure Veg moved to a slightly larger first floor nook eventually, where it still stands 28 years on. The ambience, service and the decor is rather basic, but it is the rustic flavours of the food dished out by second generation owner, Aman Sood and his motley retinue of cooks that seems to hold sway over regular patrons. Also, the fact that the fare is delightfully cheap further adds to its draw. Hope you enjoy this one, visit here only for the food, nothing else.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: They Lost Their Shop But Not Hope! Let’s Help Them Rebuild. EGG FACTOR Gourmet Omelettes, Bengaluru
description:
#eggfactoromelets #streetfood #bangalore

egg factor, gourmet omelets, omelette, hsr layout, south bengaluru, delicious omelets, eggs, cheese omelet, vegetarian omelet, mutton kheema omelet, chicken omelet, tiger prawn omelet,  north bangalore, street food, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, roadside eateries in bangalore, support local, support small business

A couple of years ago, I had visited Kumar, a trained chef, who had turned his passion for omelets into an interesting enterprise, Egg Factor, where he would dish up gourmet ‘eggy’ creations out of a tiny stall in HSR Layout, South Bengaluru. Soon after the video was released, customers turned up in plenty to support him and it looked like nothing could go wrong. Until he arrived one morning to find his streetside eatery demolished without notice, and to make matters worse, the pandemic followed soon after. Today, Kumar and his wife, Rajalakshmi are once again trying to rebuild their lives and their small omelet  business with a borrowed push cart that is parked outside a supportive store. Hope you enjoy this episode. Do try your best to support fledgling businesses like this that are going through tough times. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!


Note: each omelet is made of four eggs and can easily serve two, or perhaps even three people with modest appetites. Please keep this in mind when considering prices here.

title: Preparing For Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar’s Visit At VV PURAM FOOD STREET, Bengaluru | Food Trail
description:
#vvpuram #bangalore #streetfood

thindi beedhi, popular food street in bengaluru, external affairs minister, dr. s. It was a privilege for us to introduce our honourable External Affairs Minister, Dr. S. Jaishankar to Bengaluru’s most popular food street, VV Puram’s Thindi Beedhi. In the first episode of a two-part exclusive series, we survey some of the possible eateries for the Minister’s visit. I must confess this was also a wonderful opportunity to savour dishes that I hadn’t tasted in a while, and I certainly made the most of it. A big part of the street food vibe is the people that you come across, we’ve also tried to capture some of that vibe. Hope you enjoy this special episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: This Tiny Bengaluru Shop Serves Mumbai Street Food!  SRI GANESHA BOMBAY VADA PAV, Pav Bhaji, Dabeli
description:
#bangalore #streetfood #seshadripuram

sri ganesha bombay vada pav corner, seshadripuram, bengaluru, vada pav, butter vada pav, dabeli, pav bhaji, samosa, north bangalore, street food, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, vegetarian, tiffin, mumbai snacks, mumbai street food in bengaluru, eateries in bangalore, support local, support small business

Having worked in Mumbai to learn the quintessential Mumbai street food, vada pav and pav bhaji, Lakshminarayan moved back to Bengaluru to set up a small eatery, Sri Ganesha Bombay Vada Pav Stores 15 years ago. Located on a busy street in Seshadripuram, North Bengaluru, this store seems to have built a tasty reputation for itself over the years catering to the neighbourhood's pandering for Mumbai style street food. I drop into this eatery to taste the vada pav, a kutchi dabeli, samosa, and the erstwhile Mumbai mill worker staple, pav bhaji. Hope you enjoy this street food episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Although only six years old, this tiny dosae angadi is creating waves in Malleswaram for its take on the Davanagere benne dosae, smeared with a spicy red chutney to accommodate Bengaluru’s penchant for a piquant punch. My good friend, Jimmy Amrolia, and I visit here for an early Friday lunch, where we make quick work of a buttery, crackling crisp, benne masala dosae followed by an open pudi dosae. We wash it down with a cup of Hunkal Heights filter coffee at a kiosk a few meters away from Malleshwaram Dose Corner. Hope you enjoy this dosae outing; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Samosa Chaat At Sudha Chaats, Bengaluru #shorts #streetfood #bengaluru #samosa #chaat #foodloverstv
description:
Originally from Satna in Madhya Pradesh and raised in Bengaluru, Jawahar Lal always dreamt of being an entrepreneur when he worked as a North Indian cook in eateries in Bengaluru. A friend pointed him to a tiny shop on Berlie Street in Langford Town, and thus began Sudha Chaats, named after his wife, 39 years ago, to introduce Bengaluru to the joys of khasta (crisp) samosas and kachoris. Watch the complete video at https://youtu.be/hHSRNZOysyI

title: Delicious BENGALI Macher Rani, HILSA Lunch! Ilish Bhaja, Bhapa, Paturi, Jhol! ESPLANADE Bengaluru
description:
#esplanaderestaurant #bengalicuisine #bangalore

esplanade restaurant, bengali food, indiranagar, ilish, hilsa fish, hilsa festival, ilish mach bhaja, ilish paturi, kumro beguner ilish jhol, pumkin eggplant hilsa curry, bhappa ilish, steamed ilish fish, aam achari ilish jhol, seafood, river fish, bengali restaurant, bengaluru, bangalore food tour, restaurants in bangalore

Known as the macher rani, or the queen of fish, the hilsa, or ilish, is a prized monsoon delicacy for Bengalis. And when I learnt from Chef Subhankar Dhar about a hilsa festival underway at his restaurant, Esplanade, with prized specimens of the fish caught in the Padma river of Bangladesh, which incidentally is where most of the fish originate, I wasted no time in meeting him. We caught up over a delicious repast of hilsa dishes, an insightful introduction to this prized fish, and a showcase of Bengali cuisine’s delightful nuances. Hope you enjoy this episode as much as I did. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Tasting A Unique Mutton Pulav At SG Rao’s Military Hotel, Bengaluru! Soup, Kheema, Chicken Udaygiri
description:
#sgraosmilitaryhotel #bangalore #muttonpulav

sg rao’s military hotel, cottonpet, family run eatery, military hotel, naati cuisine, local cuisine,  biryani, pulaos, palav, mutton pulav, chicken pulav, chicken udaygiri, chicken kebab, kabab, kaal soup, trotters, mutton kheema, khaima, pepper chicken, chicken fry, sg rao military hotel bangalore, sg rao military hotel food lovers, bengaluru, bangalore food tour, support local, support small business

Eshwar Rao entered the kitchen of a generations-old military hotel when he was barely into his teens. It was here that he learnt age-old Karnataka-Maratha recipes from his mentor, Rukmini Bai over decades of diligent labor, that he now serves up in his rustic eatery, S G Rao’s Military Hotel in Cottonpet, Bengaluru. I met this entrepreneur, now in his forties, and caught the making of a unique military style pulav, in addition to a tasting of some of the other must-haves here. The pulav here is cooked only with the gravy of the meat, the meat that is then layered under the rice just before serving. And interestingly, the chicken pulav too is cooked in any mutton gravy that may be available! Hope you enjoy this tasty episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Amazing Ice Cream Combinations At Old Bengaluru’s Family Run MANTAP ICE CREAM Sheshadripuram
description:
#vegetarian #icecream #bangalore

mantap ice cream, family run ice cream parlour, oldest ice cream parlour, seshadripuram, bangalore, bengaluru, chilli guava, organic honey, fresh mango, fruit fusion, dry fruit, ice cream, rose falooda, mango falooda,  family enterprise, vegetarian ice cream parlour, mantap ice cream bengaluru, ice cream in bangalore, best ice cream in bangalore, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

An acclaimed Yakshagana artist, Prabhakara Upadhyay began Saligrama’s Mantap Ice Cream in Bengaluru in 1981 when he realized the need for a business to earn a livelihood. In those days, the denizens of (then) chilly Bangalore were hesitant to eat ice creams afraid they may fall ill, and thus began a long and arduous journey of educating people to appreciate and enjoy these frozen treats. The effort seems to have paid off over the years, making this vegetarian ice cream parlour a household name amongst old Bangaloreans. From multiple outlets, Mantap has now scaled back to only one store in Seshadripuram, where Mantapa Upadhyay, (as he is popularly known) dreams up combinations that he personally puts together each morning with dairy rich ice creams that are sourced from a premium ice cream supplier. In this conversation with him and his family, I savour a range of his delectable creations - from traditional pure organic jaggery, guava chilli, to inspirations like the fruit fusion, red velvet cake, and classics like rich mango cream and caramel, and a couple of delicious faloodas too. This store is a definite must-visit if you love ice cream.

title: Gourmet On The Road Visits Goa 😎😇! Preview Video | Food Lovers TV Goa Food Tour
description:
#kripalamanna #goa #goafoodtour

goan food, goa food tour, street food in goa, goan saraswat cuisine, goan catholic cuisine, street food in goa, goan food in goa, goan fish thali, goa street food, goa food trail, goa, goa travel, goa food, restaurants in goa, gourmet on the road visits goa, goa tourism, kripal amanna in goa, support local

A visit to Goa is always memorable. It’s tough not to be taken in by its disarming ‘sussegad’ chilled-out vibe, the cheerful attitude of friendly Goans who welcome visitors with open arms, its vibrant culture and customs, and last but not the least, its food that is rich in its traditions, varied and flavourful. We stayed a week in Goa exploring its culinary fare, from meals in fabled, century-old institutions, to establishments that serve up a delightful showcase of community cuisine, Saraswat and Catholic, to uncovering some tiny unsung hole-in-the-wall joints, savoring street food and more. Stay tuned to Food Lovers TV over the next few weeks as we roll out these Goa episodes; each eatery featured a must-add to your next Goa visit. For now, here’s a preview of what’s in store. Happy eating!

title: Bombat Vidyarthi Bhavan Full Breakfast With Legendary Sihi Kahi Chandru!
description:
#vidyarthibhavanbangalore #sihikahichandru #kripalamanna

south indian breakfast, vidyarthi bhavan bangalore, sihi kahi chandru, karnataka’s most popular food television personality, kripal amanna, vegetarian, bombat bhojana sihi kahi chandru, tiffin, thindi, masala dosae, vidyarthi bhavan masala dosa, vidyarthi bhavan masala dosae, idli vada, idli chutney, vada sambar, masala khara bath, kesari bath, poori sagu, basavanagudi, bangalore, bengaluru, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local

A couple of weeks ago, I watched a beautiful Kannada play that not only chronicled the iconic Vidyarthi Bhavan but also brought alive the emotional connect that patrons have with this institution over the decades. Amongst the brilliant characters portrayed, a pivotal performance was that of famed actor and food legend, Sihi Kahi Chandru, who gave voice to the Vidyarthi Bhavan masala dosae, the heart of a tiffin experience at the 77-year-old eatery. In the course of our conversation backstage, Chandru Sir and I quickly decided we should savour a full tiffin at Vidyarthi Bhavan soon. This isn’t your typical Gourmet On The Road episode, but it makes an attempt to capture our experience at the breakfast that followed. Hope you enjoy this one. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

title: Is This Jayanagar’s Oldest Bajji Bonda Cart? 42 Years KUNDAPURA BONDA BAJJI SHOP, Bengaluru
description:
#streetfood #jayanagar #bangalore

popular bajji shop in jayanagar, south bangalore, vegetable, pakora, bonda, capsicum masala bajji, aloo bonda, potato, mirchi bajji, street food, jayanagar, 4th block jayanagar, jayanagar street food, bengaluru, vegetarian eatery, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

Krishna Poojary migrated from his hometown in Kundapura to Bengaluru nearly half a century ago in search of a livelihood. After a string of odd jobs in eateries, he decided to try his hand at a bajji (fried fritter) gaadi (cart) in Jayanagar 4th block, Bengaluru. It’s been 42 years since; the location of his cart has changed from one street to another over the years, but the place that his fried wares occupy in the hearts and palates of his neighbourhood patrons remains constant to this day. Also perhaps making Kundapura Bonda Bajji Shop one of the area's oldest street food carts! I visited him one cloudy Bengaluru evening to taste all the bondas and bajjis he and his son have on offer. 

Hope you enjoy this episode in our ongoing initiative to support small businesses, do support your neighbourhood eateries too. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Must Stop Here For Menthe Dosae, Bassaru, Shavige… HOTEL LATHA VEG Kota | 60 Years,Honestly Priced!
description:
#lathaveg #kota #breakfast

hotel latha kota, popular vegetarian restaurant, kota, kundapur, south canara, mangalore kundapur highway, menthe dosae, dosa, shavige, ragi mudde, bassaru, moode, kote kadubu, goli baje, kesari bath, sana polo, coffee, 60 year old restaurant, latha veg, latha veg kota,mangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

Mr Balakrishna Prabhu and his wife, Sarojini began a tiny eatery in Kota, 60 years ago, then a little village enroute to Kundapur. Slowly but surely, the reputation of their tasty South Canara vegetarian fare cooked to family recipes grew not just with the support of locals, but travellers too for whom a visit to Hotel Latha was de rigueur after darshan at the famous Shri Amrutheshwari temple, located nearby. And served at prices that most would say are downright cheap in current context. Today the second and third generation father and son duo of Venkatesh and Rajesh Prabu tend to this eatery’s affairs, overlooked by the matriarch of the house, Mrs. Prabhu. I stop by for a delicious breakfast spread of menthe dosae, ragi mudde, basaaru, shavige, moode and more. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

title: Best Traditional Karnataka Breakfast At KAMAT LOKARUCHI, Popular Mysuru Highway Eatery For 27 Years!
description:
#kamatlokaruchi #ramanagara #breakfast

27 year old vegetarian eatery in ramanagara, popular mysore highway eatery, kamat lokaruchi, best traditional karnataka food, moode, neer dosae, chow chow bath, khara bath, kesari bath, breakfast, lunch, dinner, ramanagara, traditional meal, kamat lokaruchi ramanagara, kamat lokaruchi bangalore-mysore road karnataka, karnataka, karnataka food tour, support local

An eatery that began the Kamat Yatriniwas group’s foray into highway restaurants twenty seven years ago, Kamat Lokaruchi in Ramanagara serves the nourishing fare of rural Karnataka in an earthy atmosphere that seeks to connect diners to the land. Traditional staples are cooked over old fashioned stoves fuelled by wood to recreate authentic flavours of yore, the culinary philosophy employed here also shuns the use of artificial color and additives. Since they first opened doors, numerous eateries have mushroomed on the Mysuru highway, but even today, over quarter of a century later, Kamat Lokaruchi reigns supreme as one of the most popular eateries on the route. I caught up with Narayan Kamat, son of the late A. S. Kamat who established the Kamat Yatriniwas group, and also explored the kitchens and some wholesome dishes here. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

If you’re on Marina Beach in Chennai and fancy a seafood sapad (meal), then Sundari Akka’s Kadai seems to be the place to go. I visited this beachside stall one evening to savour some spicy fish curry, rice, plump prawn thokku and fish fry for a modest sum of Rs. 370. The fare here is rustic in its appeal and the sort of thing you do to tick an item off a Chennai food trail list and experience the city’s beach vibe. title: This Legendary MAKKAN PEDA Sweet Goes Back 190 Years! ARCOT CHETTIYAR SWEET STALL, Near Vellore
description:
#makkanpeda #chettiyarsweetstall #arcot

arcot chettiyar sweet shop, arcot chettiyar mittai kada, arcot, vellore, must-try sweet, makkan peda, mitai, sweetmeat, traditional mithai, chennai highway, tamil nadu food tour, popular restaurants, highway eateries, chennai food tour, tamil nadu, gourmet on the road food tour, kripal amanna, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business, support local

When in Arcot, Northeastern Tamil Nadu, those in the know make a beeline for Chettiyar Mittai Kadai, home of the legendary makkan peda that was first made here nearly two centuries ago by Govindasamy Chettiyar, inspired by a mithai that he tasted in the palace of the Nawab of Arcot. I caught up with his fifth generation, Mr. Sundaram, to find out what goes into the making of this flour and khoa dumpling stuffed with a mixture of 11 dry fruits and nuts, before being fried gently in oil over a wood fire until golden brown and then left to soak in sugar syrup. Hope you enjoy this delectable sweet episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Makkan Peda
Rs. 35 (usd 0.5) per piece
10/10

What I find most appealing about a good North Karnataka meal is its balanced approach when it comes to nutrition, the meal components, both raw and cooked, dishes that complement and contrast, not just in taste and textures, but also in the warming and cooling impact that they have on the body. A good representation of this culinary ethos is the jowar bhakri meal served at Kamat Bugle Rock in Basavanagudi. Part of the Kamat Yatri Niwas group that first brought North Karnataka cuisine to Bengaluru in a restaurant format, this 17-year-old eatery serves a satisfying jolada rotti oota, albeit with flavours slightly tweaked to better suit the palate of this South Bengaluru suburb. Hope you enjoy this watch. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: This Couple Brings Authentic Kolkata Kathi Rolls To Bengaluru! CHAKUM CHUKUM
description:
neighbourhood eatery, popular roll shop, calcutta kathi rolls, rolls, chicken tikka roll, veg rolls, vegetable chop roll, paneer roll, mutton roll, egg roll, indira nagar, street food, bengaluru, bangalore, local, small business, local business, inspiring story, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When work brought Arpita and Sujoy Das to Bengaluru 13 years ago, they yearned for the flavours of Kolkata's street fare, more specifically the Calcutta kathi roll. Since they could find none, Arpita decided to open a tiny 150 square feet shop cooking and serving up this quintessential Kolkata eat-as-you-go treat. It was only a matter of time before Sujoy quit his advertising job to support this small enterprise that has since built for itself a loyal following not only for its rolls that are made completely in house, including the spice mix with a few ingredients shipped from Kolkata, but also their Kolkata style kebabs and biryani in recent times. I visit them for a late lunch and make a meal of three tasty kathi rolls.

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong; please do support businesses in your neighbourhood. Happy eating!

title: Making Of SREENIVASA BRAHMINS BAKERY Iconic CONGRESS KADLEKAI | Tasting KBC, Capsicum Puff, PalyaBun
description:
#sreenivasabrahminsbakery #vegetarian #bangalore

popular bakery, traditional bakery, pure vegetarian bakery, bengaluru, basavanagudi, sreenivasa brahmins bakery, sreenivasa brahmins bakery bangalore, congress kadlekai, bread, kbc, khara bun butter congress, khara bun, palya bun, capsicum puff, nippat, bun butter jam, aloo bun, honey cake, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

HR Ramaswamy Iyengar came to Bengaluru from Holenarsipur in 1956 and set up a bakery in Basavanagudi, an old market area surrounded by villages where groundnuts were cultivated. Selling a limited variety of pure vegetarian breads, buns and biscuits, the bakery fell upon hard times due to the rationing of flour and other essentials in the seventies. Faced with dire prospects, Ramaswamy Iyengar looked at the plentiful groundnut for survival and in doing so hit upon a unique recipe combining peanuts with a blend of spices that he named the Congress kadlekai, owing to the legend that during British times, secret notes were sent by Indian National Congress party workers hidden in sacks of groundnuts. I spent an afternoon with the second and third generation of the Sreenivasa Brahmins Bakery family to watch the making of the iconic Congress kadlekai and also taste some of the traditional items that make this 66-year-old institution a hit not just with locals, but also with Bengaluru diaspora across the globe who throng here for the kadlekai, nippat, khara buns, palya buns, puffs and other traditional Iyengar bakery treats.

title: He Quit His Job For His Love Of Momos! Freshest Momos At MOMO SHOP, Bengaluru!
description:
#momoshop #momos #bangalore 

neighbourhood momo shop, vegetable momo, mushroom momo, paneer momo, chicken momo, wholewheat momo, fresh momo, street food, bengaluru, bangalore, local, small business, local business, inspiring story, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

In our continuing initiative to support small businesses, we visit Momo Shop, a passion enterprise of Ronald George who fell in love with momos whilst pursuing an advanced mountaineering course in Darjeeling, with plans to eventually join the army like his father and brother, both war heroes. Unfortunately, that wasn’t to be owing to an accident, necessitating him to switch tracks to a corporate career. However, after 11 years, he decided to return to his love for momos in 2010 and set up a tiny 100 sq. ft. shop in RT Nagar, North Bengaluru to serve the freshest momos. How fresh? Unlike typical momo shops which pre-cook and reheat momos to serve customers instantly, out here these steamed dumplings are prepared from scratch, from rolling out the dough to preparing the filling, only when an order is placed. This approach has won for Ronald a steady stream of customers over the years, facilitating his shop’s move to a slightly larger space. Hope you enjoy this episode enough to support neighbourhood eateries like the Momo Shop. Take care; stay safe and strong.

title: This Mother-Son Duo Make The Best Samosa & Kachori Chaat At SUDHA CHATS | Bhajji, Masala Vada
description:
#sudhachats #streetfood #bangalore 

popular samosa and kachori shop, sudha chats, berlie street, langford town, bengaluru, samosa, kachori, bajji angadi, samosa chaat, kachori chaat, bajji, vegetable, pakora, capsicum bajji, potato bonda, gulab jamun, street food, north indian, local, bangalore street food, small business, local business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Originally from Satna in Madhya Pradesh and raised in Bengaluru, Jawahar Lal always dreamt of being an entrepreneur when he worked as a North Indian cook in eateries in Bengaluru. A friend pointed him to a tiny shop on Berlie Street in Langford Town, and thus began Sudha Chaats, named after his wife, 39 years ago, to introduce Bengaluru to the joys of khasta (crisp) samosas and kachoris. The couple would cook and serve their fare piping hot; alongside the North Indian treats, their masala vada, bhajji and bonda, made interestingly with samosa stuffing, too found much favour, making their shop a popular cornerstone of the neighbourhood over time. Jawahar Lal passed on two years ago, but the tradition continues with his wife, now joined by their son, Satya Narayan. Hope you enjoy this chatpata episode. Do support neighbourhood eateries like Sudha Chats. Take care; stay safe and strong.

title: OG VARIAR & SONS | This Iconic 70-Year Bengaluru Bakery Is Bridging Tasty Traditions With Health!
description:
#ogvariarandsons #bakery #bangalore

popular bakery, traditional bakery, bengaluru, og variar and sons bakery, variar bakery, bread, wholewheat bread, wheat jaggery bread, khara bun, palya bun, nippat, coconut biscuit, jaggery wholewheat biscuit,  veg toast, vegetable puff, aloo bun, plum cake, eggless dry fruit cake, bangalore food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

OG Variar & Sons Bakery, popularly known as Variar Bakery, traces its roots to 1954 when O Govinda Variar, a native of Kannur, Kerala, set up a small bakery in Guttahalli, Northwest Bengaluru, selling breads and buns. Eventually he moved to Rajajinagar in 1970 before opening a second bakery on Chord Road, West Bengaluru. What makes Variar bakery immensely popular with locals is its philosophy that “excludes artificial additives, preservatives and chemically bleached flour in its vast range of baked products.” As a result, “there is no shining in our items,” says second generation owner, Vijaya Shankar, who is currently on a quest to substitute, to the extent possible, detrimental fats with healthier options of unrefined oil, ghee, butter across most of their range, and in certain products, maida with wholewheat flour and grains. I spent the better part of a day exploring the bakery and tasting many of the must-haves at this institution that has spawned many imitators. Hope you enjoy this slightly extended, but toothsome watch. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Tucked in a quiet, narrow alley in bustling Hampankatta, Mangalore sits Akkamakka’s Meals Hotel, an eatery that goes back 130 years! Located in a home that’s tended to by the third, fourth and fifth generation of a family that has a long tradition of serving the local community, a meal at Akkamakka isn’t just about the food, but also offers diner a nostalgic peek into the old-fashioned hospitality and way of life of a bygone era. I visit the family to get a glimpse into the history of the eatery, catch the cooking and a satisfying, very affordable, home cooked fish meal that is served on communal tables. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

description:
#chickensukka #hindumilitaryhotel #mangalore

hindu military hotel, hindu military hotel chicken sukka, kodialbail, mangalore, manguluru, chicken sukka, chicken chilli, mangalore food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

The humble chicken sukka, made popular by permit rooms in erstwhile Bombay, is a rather underrated Mangalore export,, when compared appeal-wise to its more seductive siblings like the ghee roast, etc. Which is perhaps also the reason why this unpretentious eatery in Kodialbail, Mangalore, although in existence for 64 years and popular with locals, isn't much known to those visiting. I stepped in one evening for a quick chat with the affable owner, Mr. Udayshankar, and also tasted their much-sought-after chicken sukka made to a 40-year-old recipe with an interestingly named ‘Tyson’ chicken!  Hope you enjoy this short and simple episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: Ice Cream Legend Pabba’s Latest i THALI! Tasting With 3 Generations At New PABBA’S IDEAL CAFÉ
description:
#pabbasmangalore #icecream #mangalore
 
must-try pabba’s ice creams, pabbas ice cream mangalore, pabba’s ideal cafe, bharath mall most popular ice cream parlour in mangalore, mangalore, prabhakar  kamath, mukund kamath, mangalore food tour, must try in mangalore, ideal ice creams, pabbas ice creams, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Say the word, ‘Pabba’s’ to anyone in Mangalore, or someone who has had the opportunity to visit this port city, and one is most likely to be met with a smile or in the very least, warming thoughts of  wistfulness. For very few, if at all any, in Kudla may have escaped to the alluring charm of the gadbad, tiramisu, parfait, bella candy and scores of other delicious ice cream creations concocted by S. Prabhakar Kamath, affectionately known as Pabba to family and friends, over half a century at his now iconic Mangalorean institution, Pabba’s and Ideal Ice Creams. On my visit to kudla nearly a couple of months ago, I had the opportunity to sit with him (after nearly 20 years), his son, Mukund, and grandson, Mohith, to taste their latest creation, the I. Thali, a tantalising ice cream take on the South Indian thali, at their newest parlour, Pabba’s Ideal Café, Bharath Mall, that seems to have taken Mangalore by storm going by the sheer numbers that queue outside this large restaurant. However little did I know then, that this would be my last meeting with him! This episode was conceived as a review of the I Thali, but is now in some ways a tribute to the man who put Mangalore and his legendary ice creams on the culinary map. 

Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

I Thaali
8.5/10
Rs. 279 (usd 3.7)

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

title: She Has Been Making The Fish Curry & Fry For 60 Years! HOTEL MAHALAXMI, Malpe | FISH THALI
description:
#seafood #udupi #malpe

popular seafood restaurant, affordable seafood, fish meal, affordable seafood, malpe, south canara, mangalore, mangalorean food, fish thali, fish curry, fish fry, south canara seafood, kane rava fry, lady fish, pomfret, prawns, karnataka, support local, small business

South Canara has its share of seafood eateries, but then, there are some that have endeared themselves to diners over decades by virtue of being true to the traditions they follow. One such popular seafood stop is Hotel Mahalaxmi, in the fishing village of Malpe, about six kilometres from Udupi, where Mrs. Pushpavati Bangera, the matriarch of this family run restaurant that began as a tiny hut, has been cleaning the fish and preparing the masala for the fish curry and fry each day for the last 60 years. I catch up with her and her son, Vishwanath Bangera before I sit down to a satisfying fish thali meal. 

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

title: Tasty, Hygienic Vegetarian PAAKASHALA | This Highway Eatery Enjoys A Culinary Legacy Of Six Decades!
description:
paakashala restaurant, k. n. vasudeva adiga, popular highway restaurant, for vegetarian breakfast, lunch, snacks and dinner on the bangalore mangalore highway, yediyur, bangalore mangalore highway, karnataka, south indian, breakfast, tiffin, thaali, north indian, idli, vada, dosa, dose, coffee, vegetarian

K. N. Vasudeva Adiga’s Paakashala chain of restaurants may be relatively new, but those in the know speak volumes of his and his family’s culinary legacy that spans decades. Son of Shri K V Nagesh Rao and Smt. K N Saraswati of the iconic Brahmin’s Coffee Bar, a young Vasudeva Adiga chose to forge his own path in 1984 thereafter establishing a string of successful South Indian eateries. His relatively recent venture, Paakashala, although only a few years old, has amassed for itself a solid reputation built on “his promise” of serving tasty vegetarian fare with an eagle-eye focus on hygiene. Exactly what I discovered when I ventured out to their Mangalore highway outpost at Yediyur, a 100-kilometre drive from Bengaluru.

title: Tasting The Buyyanadoddi Village Fish Fry | Spicy Jilebi Fry | MAHESH FISH FRY, Halaguru, Mandya
description:
#fishfry #buyyanadoddi #mandya 

popular village fish fry, woodfire fish fry, buyyanadoddi fish fry, buyyanadoddi, 80 kilometres from bengaluru, bangalore, halaguru, mandya district, buyyanadoddi fish, tilapia fish, jilapia fish, jilebi fish fry, village experience, buyyanadoddi fish fry maragowdanahalli karnataka 

Native to Africa and Middle East, and imported first into the country decades ago as part of a food security programme, the tilapia, a rather productive species of fish, came to be known as jilapia in native tongues, eventually acquiring the moniker ‘jilebi’ meenu or fish. And the tiny village of Buyyanadoddi in Mandya district, 90 kilometres outside Bengaluru, is making ripples with food lovers for its “jilebi” fish fry. 

The fish is caught fresh from streams in the area, marinated and then tawa fried over a wood fire, slathered continuously with a spicy green chilli paste and liberal sprinklings of crushed pepper, in a clutch of home eateries here. And over the years, its appeal seems to be catching on not just with locals but also Bangaloreans looking for a tasty outing and to experience Buyyanadoddi’s rustic appeal. 

Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Jilebi Fish Fry
Rs. 40 to 60 (usd 0.5 to 0.8) per fish depending on its size. 
8/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

ADDRESS - Mahesh Fish Fry, Buyyanadoddi, Halaguru hobli, Malavalli taluk, Mandya district, Karnataka - 571421, TEL - +919900633173
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/drniqhNsHUKxVvws5
TIMINGS - 1pm to 9pm, or until stocks last.

description:
#iyengarcuisine #vegetarian #melkote

100 year old vegetarian eatery in melukote, temple town, mandya district, pandavapura taluk, iyengar food, iyengar cuisine, brahmin cuisine, puliyogare, sakkarai pongal, bela pongal, sambar, rasam, banana leaf lunch, traditional meal, karnataka

Located around 150 kilometres from Bengaluru, the temple town of Melukote is home to culinary traditions that have evolved over centuries. Many say that quintessential Iyengar delicacies such as the sakkarai pongal, bela pongal and puliyogare trace their roots to this sacred town where one modest eatery, Subbanna Mess, has been serving traditional Melukote cuisine for nearly a century to pilgrims who journey here. In this episode, I explore the making of the puliyogare gojju, savour a delicious lunch and meet the family behind this eatery who state rather humbly, that they are merely preserving the culinary customs handed down by the generations that came before them.

Hope you enjoy this watch. Stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Veg Meal 
Rs. 100 (usd 1.3)
8.5/10 (10/10 for the bella pongal, sakkarai pongal and puliyogare)

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

ADDRESS - Subbanna Mess, Melukote, Mandya district, Karnataka - 571431; tel - +91 93435 41738
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/73GuCWbpfe1WPS717
Timings - 7:30am to 10pm
Note: Most visit for a meal or snack here post a temple visit. Hence, it can get busy on weekends or festival days.

title: Tasting Mysuru’s Popular ‘Tuppa Dosae’ At 80-Year-Old MAHESH TIFFANIES Tuppada Dose Hotel
description:
#tuppadadosahotel #maheshtiffanies #mysore 

popular dosa eatery in mysore, mahesh tiffanies, tuppada dose hotel, ramachandra agrahara, agrahara, mysuru, village tradition, tuppa dosa, tuppa dosae, vanaspati dosae, ghee dosa, masala dosa, chutney, masala vada, ambode 

Ask any denizen of Mysuru for the ‘tuppada dosae’ hotel and chances are you will be directed to this quaint shop that has stood the test of time for over eight decades in the bylanes of Ramachandra Agrahara. Begun by Mr Hollappa in the 1940s, this breakfast-only eatery is now run by his son, 86-year old Mahadevappa, and grandson, Mahesh. The must-try (actually one of only three items on the menu) here is the scrumptious Tuppa Dosae, roasted with liberal lashings of ‘vanaspati’ ghee, to accommodate “taste and budget” as pointed out by Mahesh. I dropped in for a quick chat and breakfast during a recent drive through the city. 

Hope you enjoy this watch. I take this opportunity to wish you and your loved ones a blessed Deepavali. Stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Tuppa Dosae
Rs. 35 (usd 0.5) for two dosae; 
8.5/10 (9/10 for the palya)

Ambode
Rs. 5 (usd 0.1)
8/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

ADDRESS - Mahesh Tiffanies, 2052/2, Madavachar Rd, Ramachandra Agrahara, K.R. Mohalla, Mysuru - 570004; TEL - +91 9844468787
LOCATION TAG -  https://maps.app.goo.gl/jwHv5EJyQq3HiGXu6
TIMINGS - 7:30am to 11:30am
Note: The eatery is open only for breakfast, and due to its small size and popular appeal, can get rather crowded on weekends, and may involve a bit of a wait. Service though is fast and friendly.

title: This Café Is Building A Future For The Specially Abled! ISTTA CAFÉ, Bengaluru
description:
#isttacafé #socialenterprise #bangalore

café for a cause, social enterprise, vegetarian restaurant, burgers, sandwiches, chaats, desserts, ice creams, aloo laccha tokri, kheer ice cream, support specially abled, rajarajeshwari nagar, south bengaluru, bangalore, bengaluru, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

A brainchild of IT professionals, Vasumathi Rajashekar and Prem Nithin R., this café tucked away in a nook of South Bengaluru hopes to evolve into a movement that will empower the lives of those with special abilities who struggle to integrate into society. I visit them and return, impressed not only with the tasty café fare, snacks and desserts on offer, but also by the effort that has gone into seeding an enterprise that is a much-needed initiative in a world that doesn’t always seem to accommodate those who despite being challenged have much to contribute. Hope you enjoy this episode, and will support ISTTA Café. Take care, stay safe and strong, Happy eating!

title: This Couple Wants To Share Their “Life-Giving” Sattvic Cuisine! SATKRITI SATTVIK, Healthy & Tasty!
description:
#satkritisattvik #vegetarian #bangalore

sattvik vegetarian restaurant, organic, healthy, sattvic food, organic ingredients, nutritious and tasty south indian meals, vegetarian lunch, vegetarian thaali, south indian, masala dosae, dosa, tiffin, satkriti sattvik, jayanagar, south bengaluru, bangalore, bengaluru

When Ramya Raghunath encountered a life-threatening health challenge, she and her husband, Raghunath Srivatsa turned to organic ingredients and a sattvic approach to food. What began as an experiment for a short duration has today turned into a lifestyle for this couple over the last 17 years. Convinced of its benefits, life giving in their case, they made it their mission to share this wellness-oriented culinary philosophy with society and thus was born their restaurant, Satkriti Sattvik a couple of years ago. I visited them over lunch and returned impressed both with their passion and also a delicious vegetarian meal that left me happy and satisfied. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong; happy eating!

title: This Family Is Serving 10 Traditional NAMMA FILTER COFFEEs! Kumbakonam, Maharaja, Jaggery, Karupatti
description:
#filtercoffee #jayanagar #bengaluru 

namma filter coffee, new café in jayanagar, bangalore, filter coffee, kumbakonam coffee, kumbakonam degree coffee, karupatti coffee, jaggery coffee, maharaja filter coffee, sukku coffee, traditional snacks, congress khara bun, honey cake,, chikamagalur coffee, coorg coffee, coffee traditions, south indian coffee, south indian filter coffee

It is no secret that out here in Bengaluru, we love our coffee, especially the traditional South Indian filter coffee kind. However, what is not much known is the fact that there are a variety of distinct coffee traditions in the South, based on geography, brewing and serving customs. But that’s about to change, as a mother and son duo, Anusuya and Ranjit Prakasam, have just opened a cosy filter coffee café in Jayanagar, South Bengaluru, where they brew and serve a range of 10 filter coffees that incorporate unique blends, paired even to the milk that goes in - from hand churned to A2 milk of desi cows. I pay them a visit to taste five coffees and also some of the local bakery snacks that are served alongside. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

title: This Man’s Village Butter Idli & Chutney Put PANDAVAPURA On The Map! SHIVAPPA IDLI Home, Darsaguppe
description:
#benneidli #idlichutney #karnataka 

shivappa benne idli, darsaguppe, near srirangapatna, village food, pandavapura, pandavapura idli, popular idli stop off mysore, mysuru,  highway, village tradition, butter idli, chutney, putani chutney, mandya district, bangalore mysore highway, melukote, shivappa idli hotel, shivappa idli, hotel shivappa idli 

Pandavapura, located on the state highway between Srirangapatna and Melukote in Mandya district of Karnataka, would perhaps not have registered as a breakfast stop on the traveller’s map, but for an idli shop that goes back over three decades. Actually, it isn’t even a shop, but a window in 60-something-year-old Shivappa’s home from where he dispenses freshly steamed idlis (only) with home churned butter for a few hours each morning. Travellers on the route, and even those who journey from afar just to eat here, line up outside the window, even before it is flung open at 7am.

Shivappa’s enterprise bears no signboard and he employs no one, preferring to do everything himself, from preparing the chutney and the butter to the soaking and grinding of the grain, the fermentation and steaming of the idlis, helped only by his wife. When you are here, you need to abide by his “seemingly authoritarian” rules - register your order, collect a token in exchange for your payment, and wait patiently for Shivappa to steam the idlis fresh and call your token number! This may seem like a bit of a drill, until you take a bite of the spicy chutney soaked idlis, and then it all seems to make sense. Like we discovered when we drove 130 kilometres from Bengaluru for breakfast recently. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and happy eating. 

Idli Chutney Butter
Rs. 30/ 40/ 60 (usd 0.1) for 4/ 6/ 8 idlis respectively.
9/10
Rs. 10 for extra butter

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 7am till 11am or until the idlis run out.
ADDRESS -  Shivappa Idli Hotel, Jevargi - Chamarajanagar Rd, Darasaguppe, Karnataka 571435; tel: +91 99729 14888 
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/mNoqcdBzvVnGBDFq7
Note: Shivappa’s Idli has no sign, the google maps coordinates bring you right at his door, where one usually sees people milling around a window. He also places three blue drums outside for people to identify his home. :-)

title: Must-Try Original Kutchi Dabeli At DABELIWALA, Bengaluru! Delicious Street Food Snack From Gujarat
description:
#dabeli #streetfood #bangalore

popular gujarati snack, dabeli, kutchi dabeli, dabeli in bengaluru, gujarati food, gujarat food, dabeliwala.com, dabeliwala, kutchi double roti, snack from kutch, gujarat, street food, jp nagar, bangalore 

Invented as an unfussy double roti (bread) snack in the Kutch region of Gujarat over half a century ago, the dabeli (meaning pressed, in Gujarati) has since travelled the state and beyond, gaining popularity for its delicious composition - potatoes enlivened with a medley of spices, fruit, condiments, crunchy nuts and fritters, stuffed into a pav - that tingles with the sharpness of sweet, spicy and sour flavours. And like every other crowd-pleasing culinary creation, the dabeli too has spawned multiple avatars, this street cart that I visited had over 10, including a decadent double butter, cheese and dry fruit loaded version too. But it was the original, non-pretentious Kutchi Dabeli, resonating in its myriad flavours and textures, dished out by Yogesh Rathod at his Dabeliwala.com streetfood enterprise that made the most memorable impression on my palate. Hope you enjoy this scrumptious episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!
