title: PURNABRAMHA Maharashtrian Vegetarian Cuisine| A Woman’s Tribute To Authentic Flavours Of Her Land
description:
#vegetarian #jayantikathale #bangalore

purnabramha, popular maharashtrian restaurant, jayanti kathale, lady entrepreneur, woman enterprise, maharashtrian vegetarian cuisine, bangalore, vada pav, sabudana vada, kothmir vadi, vada, maaswadi rasa, narayangaon, maharashtra, pune, bharleli vaangi, eggplant, varan bhaat, dal rice, modak, ganesh chaturthi, puran poli, shirval, 

A 27-hour flight from Australia to Bengaluru sans any vegetarian food for her husband and child spurred Jayanti Kathale to give up her career as an IT professional and set up an enterprise fuelled by the mission of propagating vegetarian Maharashtrian cuisine across the globe. With a humble beginning, selling modaks online, Purnabramha has evolved into a full-fledged restaurant offering with multiple centres in India and overseas. I catch up with this firebrand entrepreneur at one of her restaurants in Bengaluru, watch the making of a unique maaswadi rassa, a dish from Narayangaon, before sitting down to a satisfying Maharashtrian meal that begins with an expected vada pav and sabudana vada but travels far beyond. Hope you enjoy this episode. Stay safe and happy eating!


Solkadi
An appetising start to the milk, sour kokum extract infused in spiced coconut milk.
Rs. 150 (usd 2)
8/10

Vada Pav
The vada pav here is served in the traditional Maharashtrian style, a lightly flavoured batata vada in a laadi pav with a generous rub of kanda-lehsun chutney, choora, fried batter pearls for crunch, and lavangi, salted and fried green chillies. 
Rs. 35 (usd 0.5)
8.5/10

Sabudana Vada
A textbook sabudana vada, crisp and crunchy on the outside and moist and yielding inside. The spicing is minimal in keeping with its reputation as a ‘upavaschi faraal’ or fasting snack. The sweet and sour yoghurt dip is a perky accompaniment to the vada.
Rs. 154 (usd 2) for 6 pieces.
8/10

Kothmir Vadi
The sort of snack that you would find in a Maharashtrian home. Generous amounts of coriander (kothmir, in Marathi) combine with spices and chickpea flour in two versions, steamed and fried. I preferred the fried version. 
Rs. 176 (usd 2.3)
7/10

Combo Main Course Platter
A great plate to taste the depth and variety of Maharashtrian cuisine in dishes that aren’t commonplace. The spicy rasa grips you by the throat, the soft and wholesome tandala chi bhakri (rice rotti) helps tone down the spicy fervour of the rasa. The maaswadi, a vegetarian’s imaginative take on the bone and marrow concept, is an interesting play of flavours and textures - smooth, spicy chickpea paste that’s stuffed with a mixture that comprises sesame seeds, coconut, peanuts, etc. if you like it spicy, combine the bhakri with the chilli thecha and onions. The bharleli vangi offers a flavourful bite, swathed in a nutty peanut based gravy,
Rs. 280 (usd 3.7)
9/10

Thup Varan Bhat Nimbu 
A simple, soul-pleasing plate of mildly flavoured daal (varan) seasoned with toasted thup (ghee), served with rice. There’s some methkut, a five-lentil, spice and asafoetida concoction, on the plate for added punch.
Rs. 110 (usd 1.5)
8.5/10

Shirval
A vegan-friendly, low on sweetness dessert, made of rice flour that’s collected into a dough, poached, before being pressed into noodles that are then steamed. The steamed noodles, combined with coconut cream, a touch of jaggery and almond flakes, is the delicate sort that dissolves when placed in the mouth. 
Rs. 350 (usd 4.7)
8/10

Modak
Lord Ganesha’s favourite sweet, Purnabramha’s modak is a must-order. Within the austere exterior of the modak lurks a caramelised, coconutty mixture, fortified with reduced milk, that will sing to your palate. 
Rs. 150 (usd 2) for 4 pieces.
10/10

Puran Poli
Purnabramha has sold 750,000 of these, and for good reason. Jaggery-sweetened chickpea paste flavoured with a touch of nutmeg and rolled in a wheat dough, this is the sort of dessert that’s best enjoyed with plenty of thup (ghee)! 
Rs. 90 (usd 1.2) 
9/10

ADDRESS -  Purnabramha, VCR Stone Corner, 780, 17th Cross Road, Opp Pappu Chaywala, 1st Sector, HSR Layout, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560102; tel +91 81056 45499
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/9Bn528LKAHCqPbZcA
Order online at www.purnabramha.com

title: Tasting East Bengaluru’s Insanely Popular  MALLIKA WOOD-FIRED BIRYANI | Mutton Curry, Chicken Fry
description:
#mallikabiriyani #muttonbiryani #bangalore

Bengaluru’s Newest Biryani Craze, Mallika Biriyani, sells over 500 kilos of meat biryanis every weekend! Mutton biryani, chicken biryani, homestyle mutton curry, chicken fry, liver fry, boti fry, raagi mudde, kothanur, east bangalore

Mallika Biriyani is the fascinating story of a computer engineer who began a biryani shop six years ago with an investment of Rs. 10,000 after a string of failed ventures. In the early days, he would procure a kilo of mutton each day, today the shop has evolved to a bustling biryani destination which procures over 500 kilos of meat on weekends to cater to the thronging crowds here. I make a 20-km trek through town to the far flung suburb of Kothanur in East Bengaluru to catch up with Venkatesh for a close look at his enterprise, and also taste the five or six dishes on offer here including his unique wood-fired biryani creation which comes across as a delicious confluence of various styles. Hope you enjoy this episode. Stay safe and happy eating!

Mutton Curry
A pleasing homestyle mutton preparation that’s cooked slowly on a wood fire, the fat in the meat renders into the gravy giving the curry a lip-smacking unctuous richness. The meat slides off the bone, the curry is a great combination with the rice and raagi mudde. If you need one reason to make the trip to Mallika, this would be it!
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4)
10/10

Chicken Fry
Made in a flavour coriander-greenchilli-coriander masala, this is a zesty chicken dish. The meat is cooked perfectly down to the bone. 
Rs. 80 (usd 1.1)
8/10

Boti Fry
The boti is soft, cooked well and spiked with loads of pepper. Its only fault however, its sandy griminess on the bite, which can be difficult to get past when you are eating offal.
Rs. 100 (usd 1.3)
6/10

Liver Fry
A preparation, identical to the pepper-laced boti fry, it’s a pity the flavourful warmth of the masala could not penetrate the ‘tough-on-the-bite liver.
Rs. 100 (usd 1.3)
7/10

Chicken Biryani
The biryanis are served in large portions, there’s plenty of rice, and 5 or 6 pieces of chicken, which makes it a great biryani to share. On the nose, there’s the smokey character from the wood-fire, you can taste the depth of flavour in the rice from the spices. The meat is moist, though mellow in its flavours and benefits from being eaten with the flavourful rice, that is a mixture of two varietals, the ‘starchy’ short-grained seeraga samba and the ‘low on starch’ medium-sized-grain, bullet variety.
Rs. 130 (usd 1.7)
8.5/10

Mutton Biryani
Seven or eight pieces of meat in a mutton biryani at Rs. 230 makes it great in terms of value, and perhaps also lends to its mass appeal. The spicing and masala is identical to the chicken version, but the character of the mutton, with a bit of fat, imbues the biryani with a mellow, warming flavour note that’s more rounded on the palate. The meat is juicy, and has a bit of a bite. If you like your flavours a bit punchy, taste it with the sherva, the gravy of the mutton curry.
Rs. 230 (usd 3.1)
9/10


ADDRESS -  Mallika Biriyan, Bileshivale Main Rd, Near SSR College, Essel gardens, Bileshivale, Karnataka 560077; tel +91 97418 49680
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/Sd6x5FcdckcF2xvt7

title: Bengaluru’s Popular TAAZA THINDI Removes Best Selling MASALA DOSA From Menu To Prevent Overcrowding!
description:
#taazathindi #vegetarian #bangalore

taaza thindi, must-visit for its tasty south indian tiffin, hygienically prepared and affordable! vegetarian, breakfast, tiffin, south canara cuisine, taaza thindi, jayanagar, bengaluru, bangalore, lunch, popular eatery, south indian, karnataka, masala dose, masala dosa, idli, vada, chow chow baath, khaara baath, kesari baath, coffee

When it comes to the hygiene aspect in a mainstream eatery, Taaza Thindi rivals the best with its clean approach to cooking and serving delicious South Indian tiffin fare. Not due to current covid 19 compulsions, but from when they began operations six years ago. In the current scenario, they have taken matters a step further as I discovered when I visited their flagship Jayanagar restaurant recently to savour their best selling masala dose. Turns out they have stopped making dosas altogether just because the three to four-minute ensuing wait for one would have customers crowding, making it difficult to maintain social distancing owing to space issues at this outlet. “It’s a huge loss financially especially in these difficult times”, say the founders, but “we didn’t want to compromise with the wellbeing of our customers and employees!” 
Mildly disappointed with the absence of the dosa, I sought solace in their equally pleasing idli vada and chow chow baath combo, the latter featuring a comforting khaara baath made with bansi rawa. Hope you enjoy this episode, stay safe and happy eating.

Previous Taaza Thindi video link:
HYGIENIC, TASTY & AFFORDABLE! Tiffin At TAAZA THINDI | Most Popular SOUTH INDIAN SNACK Destination https://youtu.be/1yIYi4pRZm8

Idli Vada
The idli is grainy and porous in texture allowing for the ‘runny’ chutney to seep through and imbue it with its spicy fervour. The vada exudes a near ‘biscuity’ crunch and is simple and clean in its flavours. 
Rs. 12 (usd 0.2) per idli/ vada
8.5/10

Chowchow baath
Made with bansi wheat rava, the khara baath is porridge-like in its consistency. On the palate, it exudes savoury, spicy flavours tinged with the tartness of tomato. The kesari bath is rich, in ghee, toasted cashew, raisins, and also incorporates the fruit of the season, and the spicy tinge of cloves.
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3)
8.5/10


ADDRESS -  Taaza Thindi, 1004, 26th Main Rd, 4th T Block East, 9th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560041; tel +91 80 4091 2277
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/tKhbVWrmJ1eGmfXS8

title: MY LAST MEAL At KOSHY’S BENGALURU | Fish Biryani, Kerala Prawn, Tomato Cheese Toast, Mutton Omelette
description:
#koshys #bangalore #popularrestaurant 

popular bangalore restaurant, bengaluru, koshys cafe, koshys bakery, jewel box, popular breakfast in bangalore, popular lunch, coffee shop, bakery, all day breakfast, mutton omelette, tomato cheese toast, fish biryani, kerala prawn fry, chilli chicken, plum cake, coffee

Most of my visits to Bengaluru’s iconic Koshy’s, an eatery that dates back to pre-independence times, have almost always been for their all-day breakfast. Simple omelettes, comforting toasts made with wholesome bread from their bakery, old-fashioned cutlets and sandwiches, the sort that can brighten up a dull day. In this episode, filmed just before they closed doors owing to the current crisis, I partake of a couple of their breakfast must-haves, their crowd-pleasing fish biriyani and a prawn fry that pays ode to the establishment’s Keralan roots, and also take a look at how they tried their their best to keep serving customers in these trying times. I hope this landmark cafe, an indelible part of the city’s history, emerges stronger in due course. Take care and stay safe.

Do catch our previous Koshy’s episode for an in-depth look at their history and the must-have breakfast dishes here:
KOSHY’S BEST BREAKFAST DISHES| Mutton Cutlet, Appam Stew, English Brekkie... Exclusive KITCHEN TOUR https://youtu.be/YCMp44D6jak

Tomato Cheese Toast
This dish celebrates the sweet tartness and textures of tomato - crisp dices, sauteed near pulpy bits and thick sauce slathered over thick toast of Koshy’s homemade bread. Shavings of cheese round off the flavours with savoury notes. 
Rs. 170 (usd 2.3) 
8/10

Mutton Omelette
Food doesn’t have to be complicated, but the sort where it touches your soul. Like this simple omelette, beaten egg rolled around mutton mince that seasoned sparingly, sings the flavor of the meat. Savoured with some toast and butter, this is the breakfast of Koshy’s champions!
Rs. 240 (usd 3.2) 
8/10

Chilli Chicken
Koshy’s version of this Sino-Indian staple that one will only find in India is generous in the peppers and onions, but lacking in some chilli punch one would expect. I also wish the sauce had permeated the chicken better. 
Rs. 360 (usd 4.8) 
6/10

Fish Biriyani
This fish biriyani has been on Koshy’s menu for decades and is the sort that requires one to redefine the notions of a biryani. Composed of plump steaks of kingfish, fried, cooked in a gravy and then topped with basmati rice, it isn’t one for the biryani purist, but certainly makes an impression on the palate.
Rs. 430 (usd 5.8) 
7/10

Kerala Prawn Fry
A delicious preparation of tiny fried chemmeen, prawns. One can taste the sweetness of the prawns juxtaposed against the toasty herbaceousness of the curry leaves, the singe of pepper, the lilt of coriander and other spices.
Rs. 500 (usd 6.7) 
9/10

Plum Cake
Koshy’s plum cake has legions of fans not just in Bengaluru and the country but across the world. The fruits are macerated, rendering a slightly bitter edge against the sweetness and subtle spicing of this plum cake that is not as heady and alcohol-laced as some traditional cakes can be. It makes for the perfect sweet close to a meal here with some coffee.
Rs. 40 (usd 0.5) 
9/10

Koshy’s Special Coffee
Rs. 52 (usd 0.7) 
8/10

ADDRESS- Koshy’s Parade Cafe, No. 39, St Marks Road, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001
LOCATION TAG- https://goo.gl/maps/N8rjbD3qRNwwdu8x8

title: Exploring Bengaluru’s Timeless IYENGAR BAKERY Tradition At 60-Year-Old Sri Jayalakshmi Bakery
description:
#iyengarbakery #traditionalbakery #bangalore 

popular bakery, traditional bakery, bengaluru, iyengar bakery, benne biscuit, vegetable puff, egg puff, aloo bun congress, khara bun, bun butter jam, dilpasand, honey cake, almond biscuit, salt biscuit, khara biscuit

The Iyengar Bakery is an integral part of Bengaluru’s culinary landscape. Located in almost every neighbourhood of the city, these traditional bakeries date back to the turn of the last century when two Iyengar brothers from the Ashtagrama (a cluster of eight villages) area in Hassan made their way to Bengaluru in search of livelihoods, and built on the legacy of British bakeries with their own customs and flavours. Over the years, more from the community followed in their footsteps, a trend exacerbated by the famine of the 50s which rendered agriculture in the villages unviable, leading to the rapid growth of Iyengar bakeries in Bengaluru, Mysuru and elsewhere in the South.  In this episode, I visit Sri Jayalakshmi Bakery, a 60-year old bakery that though rooted in its traditions has made space to evolve with the times. Needless to say, I also taste many of the calorie-laden but deliciously addictive goodies that have built for these time-honoured establishments a loyal fan following over the years. Hope you enjoy this one, stay safe and happy eating!

Benne (butter) Biscuit
The sort of cookie that’s crumbly, fragile and almost melts in the mouth. 
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) per 100 gm 
8/10

Vegetable Puff
Bite into the airy crunch of layers of pastry that traps within its folds a flavourful vegetable stuffing. A popular snack anytime of the day. 
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3) 
8/10

Egg Puff
One you get past the airy crunch of the pastry layers, you taste the creamy egg bhurji that's fortified with half a boiled egg. Reason why these outsell the vegetable puff in a traditionally vegetarian establishment.
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3) 
9/10

Khara Bun
A generous hit of curry leaf and green chilli in a spice mix stains this popular bun a yellowish green and also gives it a spicy bite. The savoury notes of toasted onions and a smidgen of sugar rounds off the flavours on the palate.
Rs. 15 (usd 0.2) 
9/10

Aloo Bun Congress
Picture a soft bun stuffed with a creamy, lightly tempered potato mash. Slice it open and slather on a generous helping of spiced peanuts. That’s the ABC for you. Soft and creamy with the toasty, spicy crunch of peanuts, delicious down to the last bite.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) 
9/10

Bun Butter Jam
A sweet, raisin speckled bun sandwich slathered with salted butter and Sri Jayalakshmi’s homemade mixed fruit jam, on the palate it evokes memories of a comforting bread, butter jam sandwich packed in a school snack box.
Rs. 32 (usd 0.4) 
8/10

Dilpasand
Sri Jayalakshmi Bakery’s most popular sweet offering is the sort of calorie-laden indulgence that helps you get past a bad day, if you are having one.Puff pastry stuffed with freshly grated coconut, raisins, glazed cherries, tutti frutti, cashew nuts and scented with cardamom! Sweet Bliss!
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3) 
10/10

Honey Cake
Another one for the sweet tooth, a butter sponge cake dipped in a sugary syrup and rolled over in desiccated coconut. The sweetness, though is cut, thankfully, by the acidity of the jam that’s smeared on top.
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3) 
7/10

Almond Biscuit
The sort that breaks off in a crisp, soft, crunch.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) per 100 gm 
8/10

Salt Biscuit
Initially, you taste almost nothing, but then you are surprised by its salty spike that makes a late appearance on the palate. 
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) per 100 gm 
8/10

Khara Biscuit
Flavours of the khara bun - curry leaf, chillies, onions and jeera - but in a biscuit form.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) per 100 gm 
8/10

ADDRESS -  Sri Jayalakshmi Bakery, No.1, Lal Bagh Main Rd, Srinivas Colony, Sudhama Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560027; tel +91 99458 89911
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/ppE2Pvju9zW368W47

More about Congress Kadlekai - https://youtu.be/ywoC-HkXNIc

title: Making The Nellore-Style ANDHRA BIRYANI At Most Popular NANDHANA PALACE | Tasting 13 Iconic Dishes
description:
#nandhanapalace #andhracuisine #bangalore

andhra cuisine, meal, andhra biryani, nellore biryani, nandhana palace, bangalore’s largest andhra restaurant chain, sholay kebab, drumstick soup, mutton bone soup, chilli chicken, chicken kshatriya, chicken amravati, nellore mutton biryani, mati kodi biryani, chicken biryani

In good times or bad, Bengaluru loves its biryani and the one biryani that is perhaps most favoured here is the Andhra biryani. A biryani that’s nuanced in its depth of flavour and finds its roots in the Nellore district of Andhra Pradesh. In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, I catch the making of this traditional biryani from start to finish at the newest outpost of Bengaluru’s largest chain of Andhra restaurants, Nandhana Palace. In doing so, I chat with second generation owner, Shweta Ravi, and learn of her family’s commitment to culinary traditions over three decades, and also savour the many creations of the kitchens here that are now synonymous with Andhra cuisine. Hope you enjoy this one. Stay safe and happy eating!


Drumstick Soup
Made of drumstick marrow and leaves, this is a soup that’s warming and rich in nutrients.
Rs. 95 (usd 1.3) 
8/10

Mutton Bone Soup
Mutton bones simmered over hours into a spicy broth, served with a tender piece of meat that offers a juicy bite of this soup. 
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6) 
9/10

Carrot 65
There’s little in the flavour of the reddish-orange batter-fried discs tossed in garlic, curry leaves and spices that reveals it’s made of carrots! If you are a vegetarian looking to savour the flavour of the legendary chicken 65, this Nandhana Palace invention is perhaps the closest you can get.
Rs. 185 (usd 2.5) 
8/10

Sholay Kebab
This invention of the kitchens at Nandhana Palace is now synonymous with fried chicken Andhra style. Marinated in a yoghurt and spice masala and deep-fried, the result is a kebab that’s moist to the core and seriously addictive.
Rs. 270 (usd 3.6) 
9/10

Chilli Chicken
The chicken is coated in a sauce of naati (local) green chillies that packs a ferocious, palate-numbing punch. If you have a high tolerance for chilli heat, do pop a few of the whole chillies floating in the dish to derive the painful yet satisfying pleasure of indulging in the Andhra chilli chicken. 
Rs. 240 (usd 3.2) 
8/10

Chicken Kshatriya
This dish is an ode to the family’s Kshatriya lineage. Stained bright yellow with turmeric, the fresh flavours of the masala hold to the chicken leg, making for a flavourful bite. A touch of cashew nut also renders a rich note to the sauce alongside the pungency of garlic. 
Rs. 270 (usd 3.6) 
9/10

Amravati Chicken
Boneless morsels of chicken cooked in a semi-gravy rich in the savoury flavours of fried onions, curry leaves and hint of fennel. 
Rs. 280 (usd 3.7) 
8/10

Mutton Pepper Fry
The meat is cooked to pink tenderness and its flavour reigns supreme beyond the pepper-rich masala. The cooks at Nandhana Palace certainly know how to treat the meat right. 
Rs. 290 (usd 3.9) 
9/10

Bamboo Chicken
A tribal dish that finds its provenance in the Araku valley of Andhra Pradesh, it features chicken that’s marinated in green and red chillies, ginger, garlic and other fresh ingredients, and then poached in its juices in a sealed bamboo cross section over fire.  
Rs. 299 (usd 4) 
8/10

Nellore Mutton Biryani
Layers of flavour from the spices - cloves, cinnamon, marat moggu, bayleaf, etc., waft through your palate when you place a morsel of the basmati rice in your mouth. You can also taste the underlying sweet acidity of the pineapple, a unique ingredient of the Nellore biryani. The meat has a bit of a bite, and is flavourful. 
Rs. 290 (usd 3.9) 
10/10

Nati Kodi Biryani
Made with short-grained seeraga samba rice, the nati kodi biryani takes over the palate with its spicy, green chilli laden flavours laced with the freshness of coriander and mint, and the toasty savouriness of fried onions. The rice when tasted on its own has a salty edge which complements the feisty character of the country chicken. 
Rs. 270 (usd 3.6) 
8.5/10

Takeaway available at all Nandhana palace outlets. To order across Bengaluru, call +91 80 4613 1111
ADDRESS -  No.254, A1, Hosur Rd, next to A2B Restaurants, Bommasandra Industrial Area, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560099; tel +91 80 4613 1111

title: Tasting MAVALLI TIFFIN ROOMS (MTR) Popular Traditional Lunch Now In A New Avatar! Thaali,Masala Dose
description:
#mavallitiffinrooms #vegetarian #bangalore

vegetarian lunch, south canara cuisine, mavalli tiffin rooms, mtr, lalbagh, bengaluru, bangalore, lunch, popular lunch, south indian lunch, karnataka lunch, masala dose, masala dosa, coffee, thaali, sambar, rasam, bisi bele bath, traditional lunch, payasam, gulab jamun

In keeping with the need of the hour to minimise contact, Mavalli Tiffin Rooms iconic lunch which hitherto involved an unending procession of dishes doled out of buckets and salvers, is now confined within a ‘limited thaali’ that is by no means limiting on the appetite! The number of dishes may have been scaled back, but the satisfaction one derives from tasting their homestyle Karnataka vegetarian fare hasn't diminished in the least. And when here, one can’t let go of an opportunity to taste their legendary masala dose and their addictive coffee. Learn how Bengaluru’s oldest standing restaurant is adapting to life in the new normal! Stay safe and happy eating!

Previous Mavalli Tiffin Rooms Video links:
Exploring Traditions & Tasting the VEGETARIAN LUNCH THALI At Mavalli Tiffin Rooms | MTR | Bangalore https://youtu.be/awWIK8PuGR0

MOST POPULAR Bangalore BREAKFAST At MAVALLI TIFFIN ROOMS | Making BEST Rava Idli | TASTING 11 ITEMS https://youtu.be/L-knGepV3UE

Tasting Mavalli Tiffin Rooms’ Famous Veg Lunch | MTR Lockdown Takeaway | Rava Idli, Masala Dosa https://youtu.be/1aR18qyVZBI

Masala Dose
One can never tire of a masala dose here. Drenched in ghee, crisp to a brown roast, encasing a smear of chutney and the gatti (firm) aloo gadde palya, it’s the sort of dose that sings to your palate. 
Rs. 95 (usd 1.3) 
10/10

Limited Meals
It’s name belies its enormous proportions! On the thaali sit a couple of hot pooris accompanied with a potato saagu and a dry palya (vegetable preparation); one can also opt for the masala dose instead of the poori. And then, there’s the crowd-pleasing bisi bele bath, rich in its lentil goodness, chase this with more rice, soaked up in the sambar and rasam. And to wrap things up, a couple of desserts, a simple nuchinna goddi (broken wheat) payasam and a plump sugar-soaked gulab jamun. If you prefer to not succumb to the calling of a post-prandial siesta, order for their seriously addictive coffee.
Rs. 190 (usd 2.5) 
9/10

ADDRESS -  #14, Lal Bagh Main Rd, Doddamavalli, Sudhama Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560027; tel +91 80 2222 0022
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/546tf138essAZYnT7
Takeaway available at all MTR outlets.

title: LAST LUNCH At EBONY, Bengaluru’s Most Popular Multi-Cuisine Restaurant | Arcot Chops, Butter Chicken
description:
#ebony #bangalore #multicuisine

popular bangalore restaurant, bengaluru, ebony, 13th floor, asean on the edge, popular multicuisine restaurant, popular lunch, pan indian, asian, arcot lamb chop, kakori kebab, thai crisp vegetables, nonya prawns, dal makhni, butter chicken, diwani handi

My first meal in Bengaluru when I moved here 25 years ago was at Ebony, a restaurant perched on the 13th floor of one of the city’s earliest highrises. Dining under the stars, I distinctly remember the food, a smattering of Parsi, Pan Indian and Continental, dished up, simply minus any pretence yet solid in its flavours, much like the character of the city I now call home. I learnt later that the restaurant came into being quite by accident, born out of a crisis after its owner, Rajesh Rajaram, having bought the property as an investment was unable to flip it owing to the adverse fall out of the first Gulf war. Over the years, Ebony has successfully weathered many crises, evolving multiple avatars, the city’s most ‘democratic’ bar and more recently, an Asian restaurant. But sadly, the economic brunt of the current situation seems to have gotten the better of this Bengaluru bellwether. I visit Ebony for their last lunch service as they close shop to emerge stronger in a couple of months. Take care and stay safe. Happy eating!

Do catch our wine tasting table at Ebony here:
A Tasting Of Indian Wines From SULA & KRSMA|TASTING TABLE|Pairing Food & Wine|White Wines For Summer  https://youtu.be/p7TDogoQWok

Nonya Crunchy Butter Prawns
Despite being crumbed in a flavoursome buttery crunch that resonates the toasty herbaceousness of crispened curry leaves and the tingling heat of red chillies, the faint sweetness of the prawns shines through. 
Rs. 495 (usd 6.6) 
8.5/10

Thai Crispy Vegetables
Vegetables served up in a crispy batter with a honey-chilli combination, this was a vegetarian favourite at 13th Floor. The peppery notes of basil accents this appetiser.
Rs. 355 (usd 4.7) 
8/10

Salonee Broccoli
Moistened in a saffron-mustard marinade, the grilled broccoli florets unburden the punchy mustard flavours on the palate. The processed cheese rounds off flavours of this tasty appetiser. 
Rs. 320 (usd 4.3) 
8/10

Arcot Mutton Chops
A ghee laden lamb chop that is slow-cooked to juicy doneness, and then charred on a grill to form a delicious masala crust. A traditional Mudaliar dish, the ghee in this heroes the juicy bite of the meat. A must-have when at Ebony. 
Rs. 545 (usd 7.3) 
10/10

Kakori Kebab
Tender, rich in fat, lamb mince that is massaged with gentle spices and grilled on a skewer, these fragile kebabs leave a warming smokey, decadent impression as they melt away when placed in the mouth.
Rs. 525 (usd 6.7) 
9/10

Ebony’s Ultimate Butter Chicken
Rich in the tart sweetness of the tomatoes that cradles the tandoori spiced, grilled chicken, this is a dish that is supposedly a popular order here. I would have enjoyed a bit more kasoori methi punch in this makhan-laden dish. Having said that, it’s a dish that is comforting with a hot roti.
Rs. 495 (usd 6.7) 
8/10

Hyderabadi Deewan E Handi
Vegetables cooked in a rich cashew and onion gravy, the softened shallots add a punch of demure sweetness. 
Rs. 385 (usd 6.7) 
8/10

Malaidar Dal Makhni
Loved the smokey, buttery flavours of the dal makhni that has been cooked slowly allowing for the flavours to develop. This is a dal that I would happily return for. 
Rs. 325 (usd 6.7) 
9/10

ADDRESS - Barton Centre, 13th Floor, 84, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tel: +91 80 4178 3344
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/ebony-restaurant?share
Note: The restaurant is temporarily closed as this video was uploaded. They are expected to reopen in September 2020, do call before visiting.

title: Karnataka Style Maratha Cuisine At MARATHA DARSHAN | Mutton Korma, Raagi Mudde, Kheema Unde, Chicken
description:
#MarataDarshan #NonVegetarian #MarathaCuisine

popular non vegetarian lunch, maratha cuisine, marata darshan, military hotels, bengaluru, bangalore popular lunch spot, mutton korma, chilli chicken, ragi, raagi mudde, kheema unde, mince ball, curry, mutton liver fry, chicken biryani

Maratha warriors entered Karnataka over a couple of centuries ago, drawn to battle, but were eventually disarmed by the people, customs and traditions of the land. And so they stayed back integrating into the local community, adopting culinary practices along the way. And thus was born Karnataka style Maratha fare, distinctly different from that found in the neighbouring state. I revisit Marata Darshan, a family-run eatery that though immensely popular today had rather humble beginnings on a pushcart nearly 30 years ago. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe. Happy eating.

Do catch our previous Marata Darshan episode for an in-depth look at the kitchen, meet the family, and savour many other dishes:
MARATHA STYLE NON-VEGETARIAN Food | MARATA DARSHAN | Naati Koli Saaru, Mutton Chops & More! https://youtu.be/WF5Yb2q-0VA

Kheema Unde
These mutton mince roundels, floating in a spicy broth are soft to the touch and on the palate exude only the flavour of meat punctuated with spices. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.6) 
9/10

Chilli Chicken
The Maratha version, rich in tomatoes, green chilli and pepper; the chicken is moist and juicy, cooked perfectly down to the bone.
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
9/10

Mutton Liver Fry
The liver has bite but is still creamy, any gaminess is offset by the flavours of the pepper that the liver is roasted in. It makes for a delicious meal with the thin chapatis served here. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.6) 
8.5/10

Mutton Korma
Meat that is swathed in a generous amount of fat, the meat is cooked long until soft and tender. Barring the initial bite, it breaks down in the mouth instantly. The rice and korma are the perfect match, the rice doing well to absorb the deep unctuous flavours of the curry.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.6) 
10/10

Chicken Biryani
A local Karnataka style biryani, the rice is moist and redolent with the flavour of mint and coriander, the meat peels away from the bone and exudes a smokey aroma. It’s the sort of biryani that works well when you taste the rice and meat together, add some if you need a spicier punch.
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4) 
8/10

Address -  Marata Darshan, Kaverappa Layout, Vasanth Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560051; tel: 9902021970
Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/LzMQgsjySnPaw3Cg9

title: AIRLINES HOTEL | Bengaluru’s Most Popular Outdoor Eatery | Butter Masala Dosa, Mangalore Buns & More
description:
#AirlinesHotel #ButterMasalaDosa #DriveInRestaurant

bengaluru, bangalore popular breakfast, drive-in restaurant, garden restaurant, pure vegetarian, south indian, mangalore buns, sambar vada, medu vada, butter masala dosa, dose, akki rotti, channa bhatura, south indian snack, sambar, chutney, kesari bath, basundi, lavelle road, state bank of india road, coffee 

Named simply for the reason that an airline office was located down the road when it first opened its doors as Bengaluru’s first drive-in restaurant in 1968, Airlines Hotel harks back to a time when life was uncomplicated. As evident in its non-pretentious South Canara fare headlined by the wafer-crisp butter masala dose, that has won it legions of fans over the years, served under the magnificent verdant canopy of ancient banyan trees. Some may say the restaurant is a relic of the past, but then life has a way of coming full circle, the restaurant’s garden eating providing a much-needed social-distanced setting with the bonus of Bengaluru’s glorious outdoorsy weather. Enjoy this video. Stay safe and happy eating!

Mangalore Buns
A puffed deep-fried pastry made of maida dough that’s fortified with ripe banana, yoghurt, cumin seeds, and left to ferment. The bun is a tad chewy, the banana making its presence felt on the palate and also aiding in its subtle sweetness.
Rs. 65 (usd 0.9) 
8/10

Sambar Vada
The sort of vada that one should perhaps be tasting with steaming hot idlis if one is looking for a substantial snack. The vada isn’t crisp, but then that makes it of the perfect sponge to soak up the delicious Airlines Hotel sambar!
Rs. 65 (usd 0.9) 
7/10

Butter Masala Dosa
Loaded with butter and the resulting calories, the dose is crackling crisp and ironically a hit with Bangaloreans for whom savouring this is a ritual after an early morning walk or jog in nearby Cubbon Park! But then, to be fair this certainly a dose that can make anyone weak. Lined with a red chutney and bearing a potato stuffing that also employs the crunch of carrots and beans, this is a dose you will love if you like it crisp. 
Rs. 130 (usd 1.7) 
9/10

Akki Rotti
The akki rotti is crisp around the edges and a tad dry on the bite. However, this filling snack is redeemed by the moistness of the gentle coconut-urugadle chutney, to take the spice quotient a few notches higher, taste it with the pungent byadgi chilli-garlic chutney. 
Rs. 115 (usd 1.5) 
7/10

Channa Bhatura
A popular lunch order, this isn't your typical NorthIndian style dark-coloured and deep-flavoured chole. Get over that and you will be rewarded by a tasty combination of the chickpea with a steaming hot bhatura.
Rs. 155 (usd 2.05) 
7.5/10

Kesari Bath
Not a lush ghee-laden version of a popular Bengaluru tiffin, the version here is rich in pineapple flavours. 
Rs. 90 (usd 1.2) 
7/10

Basundi
If you enjoy dairy-richness, you will dig the lushness of this dessert, milk thickened in a pan slowly and then fortified with nuts, cardamom powder and served chilled. 
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6) 
8/10

Coffee
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7) 
8/10

ADDRESS -  No 4, State Bank of India Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tel +91 80 2227 3786
Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/e4voDdkbLHrnzpaW7

title: Full-On ANDHRA NON-VEG Meal At BHEEMA’S | Biryani, Mutton Pepper Fry, Guntur Chicken, Chilli Chicken
description:
#Bheemas #AndhraFood #Bangalore

andhra cuisine, bheema’s, bengaluru, non vegetarian meal, lunch, fish fry, chilli chicken, mutton pepper fry, guntur chicken, mutton seeraga samba biryani, chicken biryani, nellore biryani, popular bengaluru lunch spot

After many a vegetarian reviews over the last few weeks, I was craving the comfort of some hearty non vegetarian fare. And so we landed at Bheema’s to savour a spicy Andhra bhojanam of fish fry, chilli chicken, mutton pepper fry, Guntur chicken, and a couple of biryanis, their staple Nellore version in addition to their ode to Bengaluru’s dhonne style biryani! And needless to say, we also took a quick look behind the scenes to see how this popular restaurant is gearing up to serve customers in these challenging times. Enjoy and stay safe. 

Fish Fry 
A tasty fry, though not the sort that will blow your socks off! It’s a thin slice of fish, napped in a sprightly masala and fried crisp around the edges.
Rs. 370 (usd 4.9) 
7/10

Chilli Chicken
No Andhra non-vegetarian meal can be complete without a chilli chicken, rich in copious amounts of green chilli and pepper. The spice hit is tongue-numbing, but one that’s vicariously addictive. The chicken is nice and juicy all the way down to the bone. 
Rs. 270 (usd 3.6) 
8/10

Mutton Pepper Fry 
The mutton is soft and yields to a gentle bite, draped in a pepper-onion masala. The meat is sheathed in some fat, which lends it its fulsome flavour. At Bheema’s they pick their meat cuts well and certainly know how to cook it well too.
Rs. 350 (usd 4.6) 
9/10

Guntur Chicken
A chicken preparation that heroes the Guntur chilli.The creaminess of the coconut though and the acidity of tomatoes in this dish balances against the heat of this otherwise spicy Andhra chilli.
Rs. 305 (usd 4) 
8/10

Mutton Jeera Rice Biryani
Bheema’s ode to the local Bengaluru biryani, this one is made with the short-grained seeraga samba rice. You can taste the fervour of coriander, mint and green chillies alongside other ingredients like the marat moggu, cloves that are typically used in this one-pot rice and meat preparation. The meat slides off the bone, it is cooked as well as that! 
Rs. 295 (usd 3.9) 
8/10

Chicken Biryani 
Bheema’s most popular dish, this traditional Nellore-style biryani is made with basmati rice. There’s flecks of pineapple that go into this biryani and you taste its acidity juxtaposed against the aromatic flavours of cloves, cinnamon and other warming spices that the chicken and rice are cooked in. The meat is soft and juicy, however it is the delicate spicing of the biryani that makes an impression on the palate and lingers long after one has finished eating.
Rs. 260 (usd 3.4) 
9/10

ADDRESS - Bheema's, 31, Asha Building, Ground Floor, Church Street, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tell: 080 2558 7389
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/gaDweeSNAwped...


Links to other Bheema videos:
Tasting BHEEMA'S Most Popular ANDHRA VEG MEALS | MUTTON BIRYANI | Chilli Chicken | KITCHEN TOUR!

title: Tasting SOUTH BENGALURU’S Popular Vegetarian Thali & Coffee At MAIYAS | Traditions Meet Food Science
description:
#Maiyas #VegetarianLunch #Bangalore

bengaluru, bangalore popular lunch, south indian lunch, vegetarian lunch, karnataka lunch, vegetarian thali, poori saagu, kosambri, beetroot palya, vegetable, pulav, rice, sambar, rasam, anna saaru, payasam, jayanagar, south bengaluru, sadananda maiya, maiyas, coffee 

South Bengaluru’s popular vegetarian restaurant, Maiyas prides itself on serving the “purest, cleanest and tastiest food”, says 72 year-old Sadananda Maiya whose family has a legacy in food for nearly a century beginning with Mavalli Tiffin Rooms in 1924. And given his erstwhile venture, MTR Foods, it’s not entirely surprising to even find a food lab on the premises of his restaurant which merges the culinary traditions of South India with food science and technology. In this episode, I take in a quick tour of Maiyas, and also its crowd pleasing special vegetarian thali. Hope you enjoy this episode. Stay safe and happy eating! 

Special Meals
This thali has everything you need for a satisfying, nourishing meal. First on the plate are hot, puffy puris, sans any residual oil, that goes well with a creamy potato saagu, a crunchy kosambari and palya (dry vegetable preparation). Next troops in a flavourful pulao, followed by anna (rice), sambar and rasam with a sweet payasam thrown in. Best to linger over this meal, nice and slow.
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
9/10

Coffee
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3) 
9/10

ADDRESS -  Maiyas, 459, 30, 30th Cross Rd, 4th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel +91 80 4341 4400
Location Tag - Maiyas Beverages And Foods Private Limited
459, 30, 30th Cross Rd, 4th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004
080 4341 4400

title: Hyderabadi, Karnataka, Italian & Dessert | FIVE STAR DINING In The New Normal | THE OBEROI BENGALURU
description:
#TheOberoi #Bangalore #Coffeeshop 

five star dining, fine dining, bangalore, bengaluru, the oberoi bengaluru, goat cheese brulée, roomali roti, hyderabad lamb tikki, deep dish pizza, organic kale and millet soup, pan seared kolkata bekti, sea bass, panchkuta saag, apple jelly, cinnamon mousse, vegan dessert, lapis, coffee shop, all day dining

I step into The Oberoi, Bengaluru, for my first dine-in meal post lockdown, where I not only savour some of the signature specialities at Lapis, the all-day dining restaurant here, but more importantly, take a close look at the measures being employed by the hotel to ensure safety of guests and staff in these precarious times. From sanitisation of guests, their vehicles and belongings, to meticulous back of the house and kitchen processes aimed at fostering heightened levels of hygiene, to restaurant modifications that appear to not just take care of social distancing, but also airflow management, the team here seems to have made good use of the lockdown to ready services for the new normal. Hope you enjoy this episode, folks. Stay safe and happy eating!

Brulée Of Goat Cheese And Herbs
This dainty brulée of goat cheese, crested with a passion fruit vinaigrette and basil seeds, is lusciously creamy with a smokey edge and contrasts sharply with the pickled beetroots served on the plate. The pistachio granola chip provides sweet relief to complement the fat and acidity of the dish.
Rs. 775 (usd 10.2) 
8.5/10
         
Inside-out Karari Roomali Roti
A conversation starter of a dish, the humble roomali roti is roasted on a ulta tawa until crisp and slathered with a heavy hand of spiced butter. The trio of yoghurts, a puckeringly tart kairi (raw mango), beetroot and a savoury masala dip, served alongside elevates the status of the roti from being a mere nibble to that of a palate-teaser. 
Rs. 625 (usd 8.2) 
7/10
    
    
   
 
Hyderabadi Lamb Keema Tikki
A kacche kheeme (raw mince) ki tikki, the charred crust of which yields to the juiciness of the meat and the fresh crunch of onions on the bite. The flavours hark to a Hyderabadi pathar ka gosht, a possible inspiration behind the spices in this delicious lamb appetiser. 
Rs. 1025 (usd 13.5) 
9/10
 
Peri Peri Cauliflower Deep Dish Pizza
A perfectly executed Chicago style deep dish pizza, the pie is crunchy at the base and that helps hold within itself its weighty stuffing of peri peri spiced cauliflower, jalapeno and cheese. 
Rs. 1395 (usd 18.3) 
10/10

Organic Kale And Ragi Millet Soup
There’s a nutty bitterness to this soup, the sort that tastes healthy. Not a soup that’s designed to pander to your taste buds, the rajira (amaranth) and millet help in adding a touch of texture.  
Rs. 495 (usd 6.5) 
7/10

Pan Seared Kolkata Bekti
The sea bass is cooked to the perfect, crisp sear yet moist inside. The wilted spinach works well as a foil to the sweetness of the mild Creole sauce with its slightly bitter, savoury notes.
Rs. 495 (usd 6.5) 
9/10

Karnataka Lasooni Panchkuta Saag
Five varieties of greens go into the making of this saag that’s topped with roasted garlic and a generous dollop of white butter. 
Rs. 995 (usd 13.1) 
9/10

The Unbelievable Apple
This striking dessert layers apple jelly, cinnamon mousse and spiced, stewed apple core into a clever take on the apple crumble. 
Rs. 575 (usd 7.6) 
10/10

Pot Of Gold
A vegan assemblage of pink guava jelly, almond milk cream and berry compote.
Rs. 575 (usd 7.6) 
8/10

ADDRESS - Lapis, The Oberoi Bengaluru, 37-39, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Yellappa Garden, Yellappa Chetty Layout, Sivanchetti Gardens, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tel +91 80 2558 5858
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/TheOberoiBengaluru?share

title: Savouring A Traditional Meal In A Fisherman's Home, Tamil Nadu | Seafood Thokku, Kozhambu, Karuvadu
description:
#gourmetontheroad #seafoodmeal #tamilnadu

#traditionalfood #seafoodlunch #kovalam #tamilnadu #chennai #fishkozhambu #fishcurry #driedfish #fishfry #seafood #seafoodfry #gourmetbiker 

In this throwback video, I share with you a meal that I savoured in the home of Mrs Jayanti in the tiny fishing hamlet of Kovalam, Tamil Nadu. I tasted a Prawns Thokku, Para Kozhambu, and even a dried fish, Karuvadu, that tides the community through times when fish is not easily available. Hope you enjoy this short and sweet episode. 

Related video: 
A FISHERMAN’S LIFE What It Takes to Bring You Great Catch! Fishing, Beachside SEAFOOD FRY Tamil Nadu https://youtu.be/08V8k7za3lU

title: LOCAL Military Style OOTA Takeaway| ROYANNA MILITARY CANTEEN| Khaali Palav, Chicken Kebab Mutton Fry
description:
#RoyannaMilitaryCanteen #Bangalore #NonVegetarianLunch 

Takeaway Meal, Lockdown, Royanna Military Canteen, Karnataka Meal, Military Style Food, Chicken Kebab, Chicken Liver Fry, Mutton Fry, Curry Leaf Chicken, Chicken Pepper Fry, Chicken Pulav, Mutton Pulav, Pulav, Pulao, Non Veg Meals, Bangalore, Bengaluru

Just over a year old, Royanna Military Canteen seeks inspiration from the decades-old traditions of military hotels in the South, in its meaty menu that serves up naati (local) dishes. But in a format that the restaurant says is “sanitised and one that makes military-style fare convenient to families eating out.” The important question, though, does the food deliver the tasty punch that one has come to expect of military hotels that have stood the test of time? Well, I visit the restaurant and grab a takeaway of most of their dishes to find my answer. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care and stay safe.

Chicken Kebab
Not as crispy as a kebab would be when tasted at the restaurant, but the chicken is moist, juicy and flavourful. The chicken is cooked perfectly and peels off the bone. 
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
8/10

Curry Leaf Chicken
The rich masala exudes the toasty herbaceousness of curry leaf, however its flavours have not penetrated the meat as one would have desired. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.6) 
6.5/10

Chicken Pepper Fry
The chicken is moist and napped in a flavourful masala rich in onions, tomatoes, coriander and curry leaf. The onions have been roasted to a deep brown. Definitely a dish to savour at Royanna.
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
8.5/10

Mutton Fry
The meat has a bit of a bite, after all one is eating local, military-style dishes. The buttery, unctuous flavour of the fat that straddles the meat makes for a lush mouthfeel. The spicing is gentle and warming as opposed to the fiery chilli hit one sometimes encounters when dining local style. 
Rs. 280 (usd 3.7) 
8.5/10

Chicken Liver Fry
The chicken is perfectly cooked to a creamy texture, its deep flavours complemented by the pepper laced green masala. 
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
9/10

Palav
Cooked with chicken, but served minus the meat, the khaali palav is a spicy, military hotel tradition. The palav here though is mild on the palate, if you like to pick up the flavours, combine it with the sherva, the spicy broth that’s served with the palav.
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6) 
7/10

Chicken Palav
If you are looking for a bold, military-style pulav, this is not it. But if you’re looking for something mellow in flavour, this would be a good pulav to taste. The chicken benefits when tasted with the rice, the latter lending its spice notes. The pulav comes alive when combined with the spicy sherva.
Rs. 160 (usd 2.1)
8/10

Mutton Palav
The palav is deeper in its flavours helped by the character of the red meat and also the fat that’s clinging on to it. One needs to work though, to pry some meat from the bone, and also to chew on it. One of those rare occasions when I preferred the chicken palav to mutton. 
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4)
7/10

ADDRESS -  St Patricks Complex, unit 9, Brigade Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Bengaluru, 560025; tel +91 74836 15161
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/gS4RePt1HqfJF7uTA

title: A Taste of Dindigul in Bangalore | DINDIGUL THALAPPAKATTI BIRYANI Making | Mutton, Chicken & More...
description:
#DindigulThalappakatti #Biryani #Bengaluru 

Takeaway Meal, Lockdown, Dindigul Thalappakatti Restaurant, Dindigul Thalappakatti Biryani, Mutton, Chicken, Vegetable, Biryani, Mutton Chukka, Mutton Kuchi, Chicken Kodaikanal, Chicken Peri Peri, Kola Urundai,  Kuzhambu, Biryani, Bangalore, Bengaluru

In the year 1957, Nagasamy Naidu set out to sell a biryani made to his wife’s unique recipe in the then sleepy town of Dindigul in Tamil Nadu. Seated at the counter, always with a turban tied on his head, led to the eatery being popularly referred to as the Thalappakatti (thalappa - turban; katti - tied) biryani shop as opposed to its original name, Anandha Vilas, and thus was born an establishment that today owns (yes owns, not franchises) nearly 70 outposts of Dindigul Thalappakatti across the world. I visit the kitchen here to watch the cooking of their famed biryani made with small-grained seeraga samba rice, and also visit one of their eight restaurants in Bengaluru to get a takeaway bundle of their signature dishes. Hope you enjoy this episode. Happy eating and stay safe! 

Kola Urundai
Spiced roundels of mutton mince, it’s unassuming form doesn't reveal the flavourful rush of spices it delivers on the palate. 
Rs. 137 (usd 1.8) 
7.5/10

Mutton Chukka
Tiny morsels of meat, soft and yielding, with a springy bite. You can taste the grainy crunch of the coconut and the pepper hit, the perfect snack to accompany an evening tipple.
Rs. 253 (usd 3.1) 
9/10

Peri Peri Chicken Chops
The smokey, spiciness of the peri peri masala certainly perks things up on the palate alongside a zing of acidity, perhaps from some vinegar. The mayo helps assuage the spicy assault of the peri peri chicken. 
Rs. 300 (usd 4) 
8/10

Kuchi Mutton
Tender goat ribs, braised in a deep-roasted masala. The meat is soft and tender, encased in a thin veil of fat which adds to the flavour. The parotta makes for a handy bread to mop up the masala, this is a dish that epitomises the way in which DT cooks its mutton! A must-have!
Rs. 288 (usd 3.8) 
9/10

Kodaikanal Chicken Kozhambu
The chicken is moist and calming in its flavours, the spicing is mellow and cradled in creamy coconut milk. You bite into flecks of coconut as you savour this kozhambu.
Rs. 265 (usd 3.5) 
8/10

Vegetable Biryani
The seeraga samba rice heroes the Dindigul biryani powder that makes for the masala, the vegetables, beans, carrots and cauliflower, have been roasted in the masala thus imbuing in them the flavour of the biryani.
Rs. 210 (usd 2.8) 
7.5/10

Chicken Biryani
The rice is flavoursome and the chicken definitely benefits when savoured in its company. Taste it with the biryani gravy and its endearing tomato-acidity if you like to moisten things up on the palate. The boiled egg helps stretch the protein component on the plate.
Rs. 240 (usd 3.2) 
8/10

Thalappakatti Boneless Mutton Biryani
This is the biryani that’s synonymous with Dindigul Thalappakatti, and therefore it is no surprise that they do it extremely well. The seeraga samba has not just trapped the flavour of the spices, but also the smoky aromas of the meat. The meat is soft, tender and moist. This is the sort of deep-flavoured, satisfying biryani that needs no accompaniment, either the gravy or the raitha. A must-order if you’re a biryani buff.
Rs. 299 (usd 4) 
10/10

title: Make This AUTHENTIC MANGALOREAN FISH CURRY | Spicy Surmai, Pomfret, Rawas, Kane, Prawns Curry RECIPE
description:
#Mangalorean #FishCurry #Recipe

Easy Fish Curry, Mangalorean Fish Curry, Fish Curry Rice, Indian Fish Curry, Seer Fish Curry, Pomfret Curry, Prawn Curry, Mangalore, Seafood, Kudla, Easy Recipe

The Mangalorean fish curry is the perfect balance of spice, heat and sour. In this recipe episode, we cook up a seer fish curry from scratch, including a vivacious masala that lends itself well to any mild-flavoured fish like pomfret, kingfish, ladyfish, or even prawns. Its beautiful bright reddish-orange hue comes from the combination of Kashmiri & Guntur chillies I prefer to use in this traditional preparation from namma Kudla. Traditionally, the curry is prepared atleast a couple of hours ahead of meal time, thereby allowing the fish to soak up the flavoursome masala. Served with steaming hot rice, this is a curry that pleases the soul! Enjoy!

Link to Rooster Masala episode https://youtu.be/3RXHj32sToQ

Ingredients to make Mangalorean Fish Curry
Serves 3 to 4

500 gm fish, marinated in ½ tsp each of turmeric and salt.

15 red chillies (I use a combination of Kashmiri & Guntur in the ratio 9:6)
1 tbsp coriander seeds
1 tsp cumin seeds
10 to 12 peppercorns 
¼ tsp mustard seeds
12 to 15 fenugreek seeds I USED 15
A pinch of carom seeds (ajwain)
½ tsp turmeric powder
1 large onion, roughly chopped 
10 cloves of garlic
½ inch ginger, roughl chopped
Tamarind, lime sized ball 
5 tbsp grated coconut
400 ml water 
Salt to taste

For the seasoning
½ medium sized onion
20 to 25 curry leaves
Coconut oil

Please refer to the video for the method.

title: Delicious & Nutritious HAYAGREEVA MADDI Sweet Recipe | Traditional Udupi Prasadam | Chana Dal Halwa
description:
#IndianSweet #HayagreevaMaddi #ChannaDalHalwa

Hayagreeva Maddi, Hayagreeva Maddi Recipe, Traditional Udupi Prasadam, Quick Recipe For Indian Sweet, Recipe, Temple Prasadam, Hayagreeva Sweet, Hayagreeva Sweet Recipe, Hayagreeva Food, Chana Dal Sweet, Chana Dal Halwa, Nutritious Sweet, Bengal Gram Halwa, Bengal Gram Halwa Recipe, Quick Indian Dessert

The Hayagreeva Maddi is said to have been first made in the temple town of Udupi in South Canara as an offering to Lord Hayagreeva, the horse-faced avatar of Lord Vishnu. Since then, this wholesome Madhwa Brahmin dessert, made of Bengal Gram, jaggery and nuts mostly, continues to be offered as prasadam and is relished especially during festivals. Hope you enjoy my recipe adaptation of the Udupi Hayagreeva; I find in this a divinely delicious, nutritious and guilt-free fix to a sudden dessert craving, given that it can be whipped up quite easily at very short notice. Enjoy!

Ingredients to make Hayagreeva Maddi
Serves 4 to 6

1 cup chana dal (split Bengal gram)
2 cups water
1 cup + 1 tbsp  grated jaggery. 
½ cup grated dried coconut 
1 tsp green cardamom powder (about 4 to 5 cardamoms seeds)
3 to 4 cloves
11 halved cashew nuts + 4 for garnish
12 broken almonds + 4 for garnish
2 tbsp raisins + ½ tbsp for garnish
1 tbsp poppy seeds
4 tbsp ghee ghee
Pinch of salt

Please refer to the video for the method.

title: MANGALOREAN PRAWN PULAO | Make This FLAVOURSOME Shrimp Pulao | Coriander Mint Masala | MOM'S RECIPE
description:
#Mangalorean #PrawnPulao #Biryani  

Prawn Pulao, Prawn Pulav, Prawn Biryani, Mangalorean Prawn Pulao, Coriander & Mint Masala, Mangalore, Prawn Pulao Recipe, Recipe, Seafood, Prawn Recipe, One Dish Meal, Spicy Prawn Pulao, Prawn Pulav

The Mangalorean Prawn Pulao is unlike any seafood pulao. At its heart is an aromatic coriander-mint masala that complements the sweetness of fresh shrimps, and lends this rice dish an appealing greenish hue and a unique fulsome flavour. One of my favourite food memories growing up, this was a pulao cooked by my Mom on special occasions like birthdays,  with plenty of medium-sized prawns, thereby ensuring a taste of the crustacean in every mouthful. And she would also find in this pulao the perfect medium to include finely chopped carrots and beans to feed veggies to her fussy kids. ;-) This pulao recipe is truly special to me, I hope you find it special enough to cook too. Take care and stay safe. Enjoy! 

Mangalorean Prawn Pulao
Serves 4

Ingredients:

500 gm medium-sized prawns (roughly around 40 to 50 prawns) 
2 large onions, finely chopped
2 carrots, finely chopped
10 beans, finely chopped
1 cup peas
8 cloves
5 to 6 green cardamoms
1 inch cinnamon
Oil/ ghee to cook
Salt to taste

For the masala
1 big bunch of coriander and stalk,
1 cup of mint leaves 
Ensure coriander and mint are in a 60:40 ratio.
8 to 9 green chillies
1 inch of ginger, peeled and sliced
10 to 12 pods of garlic
1 tsp of turmeric powder
1 tsp salt

Please refer to the video for the method.

title: A FISHERMAN’S LIFE What It Takes to Bring You Great Catch! Fishing, Beachside SEAFOOD FRY Tamil Nadu
description:
#gourmetontheroad #fishing #tamilnadu

#fisherman #fishing #lifeofafisherman #kovalam #tamilnadu #chennai #fishfry #seafood #seafoodfry #gourmetbiker 

There is much hardship and uncertainty a fisherman endures each day to bring us our favourite harvest of the sea. In this video from our earliest culinary explorations, we travelled to the tiny fishing village of Kovalam in Tamil Nadu to spend a day with Selvam. We took a boat ride into the ocean where this sunburnt fisherman shared with us a moving account of what it takes to carry on with the traditions of his community. On our return, we stopped at his favourite stall to taste some seafood fries. Hope you find this episode an interesting watch, and take a moment to remember not just the fishing community but the many growers and producers who must face enormous difficulties to bring to us the food that nourishes and sustains us, especially in these unforeseen times. Stay safe.

title: Make The Parsi Delicacy, AKURI | Best ANDA SUBZI | Spiced SCRAMBLED EGGS | ORIGINAL Mumbai Recipe
description:
#Eggs #ScrambledEggs #EasyRecipe  

Akuri, Parsi Scrambled Eggs, Spicy Scrambled Eggs, Desi Eggs, Parsi Dish, Parsi Cuisine, Irani Restaurant Breakfast, Breakfast. Eggs, Eggs Recipe, Easy Recipe, Parsi Sambar Masala, Authentic Recipe, Mumbai, Parsi Dish, Bombay

In this lockdown recipe episode, we celebrate the humble ‘anda’ in the making of an Akuri, the spicy Parsi version of scrambled eggs. Some confuse this dish with the Mumbai street food staple, ‘anda bhurji’, but the Parsi Akuri is a different dish altogether, from its nuanced spice notes, its depth of flavour, and its texture, comparable to a savoury custard. Growing up in Mumbai, this was a dish I would savour in Irani restaurants with some kadak brun pav, or in Parsi homes. I dig deep into my food memories to cook this comforting ‘eggy’ dish, perfect for breakfast or a lazy lunch. Enjoy, stay safe and happy cooking.

Ingredients

Serves 2

3 eggs
1 tbsp ghee, you could use refined oil as well.
Knob of cold butter butter for finishing
2 medium sized onions, chopped finely (roughly ½ onion per egg) 
2 medium sized tomatoes, chopped finely (roughly ½ tomato per egg)
4 to 6 garlic cloves, finely chopped
2 to 3 green chillies, finely chopped
¾ 1 tsp red chilli powder
½ tsp turmeric powder
1 tsp Parsi sambar masala (optional) The Parsi sambar masala is that special touch that adds depth of flavour to the dish. It is a concoction of chilli powder, turmeric, asafoetida, fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, peppercorn, star anise, cloves and cinnamon, ground together, and then combined with heated sesame oil). If you don’t have this, you can use any garam masala to add flavour depth.
2 to 3 tbsp coriander, chopped
Salt to taste

Please refer to the video for the method.

title: Make Super Delicious KUNDAPUR GHEE ROAST At Home | Authentic CHICKEN/ PRAWN/ VEG Ghee Roast Recipe
description:
#Kundapur #Chicken #GheeRoast  

Ghee Roast, Chicken Ghee Roast, Prawn Ghee Roast, Veg Ghee Roast, Recipe, Shetty Lunch Home, Mangalore, Kundapur, Authentic Recipe, Karnataka, Ghee, Chilli, Chicken, Kundapur Masala, Kundapur Ghee Roast, Kundapur Chicken Ghee Roast, Ghee Roast Mangalorean Style, Ghee Roast Kundapur Style

One of my all-time favourite comfort foods is the Kundapur Ghee Roast. A dish born decades ago in a tiny eatery called Shetty Lunch Home in the then sleepy hamlet of Kundapur along the South Canara coastline. Over the years, this spicy preparation has conquered palates across the country and beyond. What gives this dish its soul is the roasted Kundapur Masala, that manifests itself in the spicy, tangy, robust flavours of this preparation. Over the years, I have tasted many ghee roasts and watched its making in illustrious kitchens, including Shetty Lunch Home. This recipe, my ode to the dish and its creators, is versatile enough to be made not only with chicken, the original chicken ghee roast, but also with prawns, paneer or any veggie of your choice. Enjoy, stay safe and happy cooking.

1 kg chicken or prawn or vegetable of your choice

For the marinade:
4 to 5 tbsp yoghurt
1 to 1 ½ tsp turmeric powder
2 tbsp chilli powder
1 to 2 tsp salt (to taste)
1 tsp lemon juice/ vinegar

For the Kundapur Masala
8 dried Guntur chillies
10 dried Byadgi chillies
2 Tsp peppercorns
1 tsp cumin seeds
1/2 tsp mustard seeds
1/2 tsp fenugreek seeds
2 tbsp coriander seeds
2 tbsp thick tamarind pulp 
16 - 20 garlic cloves
Water as required

To cook:
6 to 8 tbsp ghee 
20-30 nos curry leaves
Salt as required
1 tsp jaggery
1 tsp vinegar
A pinch of coriander powder 

Please refer to the video for the method.

title: MANGALOREAN PRAWN PULAO | Make This FLAVOURSOME Shrimp Pulao | Coriander Mint Masala | MOM'S RECIPE
description:
#Mangalorean #PrawnPulao #Biryani  

Prawn Pulao, Prawn Pulav, Prawn Biryani, Mangalorean Prawn Pulao, Coriander & Mint Masala, Mangalore, Prawn Pulao Recipe, Recipe, Seafood, Prawn Recipe, One Dish Meal, Spicy Prawn Pulao, Prawn Pulav

The Mangalorean Prawn Pulao is unlike any seafood pulao. At its heart is an aromatic coriander-mint masala that complements the sweetness of fresh shrimps, and lends this rice dish an appealing greenish hue and a unique fulsome flavour. One of my favourite food memories growing up, this was a pulao cooked by my Mom on special occasions like birthdays,  with plenty of medium-sized prawns, thereby ensuring a taste of the crustacean in every mouthful. And she would also find in this pulao the perfect medium to include finely chopped carrots and beans to feed veggies to her fussy kids. ;-) This pulao recipe is truly special to me, I hope you find it special enough to cook too. Take care and stay safe. Enjoy! 

Mangalorean Prawn Pulao
Serves 4

Ingredients:

500 gm medium-sized prawns (roughly around 40 to 50 prawns) 
2 large onions, finely chopped
2 carrots, finely chopped
10 beans, finely chopped
1 cup peas
8 cloves
5 to 6 green cardamoms
1 inch cinnamon
Oil/ ghee to cook
Salt to taste

For the masala
1 big bunch of coriander and stalk,
1 cup of mint leaves 
Ensure coriander and mint are in a 60:40 ratio.
8 to 9 green chillies
1 inch of ginger, peeled and sliced
10 to 12 pods of garlic
1 tsp of turmeric powder
1 tsp salt

Please refer to the video for the method.

title: A FISHERMAN’S LIFE What It Takes to Bring You Great Catch! Fishing, Beachside SEAFOOD FRY Tamil Nadu
description:
#gourmetontheroad #fishing #tamilnadu

#fisherman #fishing #lifeofafisherman #kovalam #tamilnadu #chennai #fishfry #seafood #seafoodfry #gourmetbiker 

There is much hardship and uncertainty a fisherman endures each day to bring us our favourite harvest of the sea. In this video from our earliest culinary explorations, we travelled to the tiny fishing village of Kovalam in Tamil Nadu to spend a day with Selvam. We took a boat ride into the ocean where this sunburnt fisherman shared with us a moving account of what it takes to carry on with the traditions of his community. On our return, we stopped at his favourite stall to taste some seafood fries. Hope you find this episode an interesting watch, and take a moment to remember not just the fishing community but the many growers and producers who must face enormous difficulties to bring to us the food that nourishes and sustains us, especially in these unforeseen times. Stay safe.

title: Make The Parsi Delicacy, AKURI | Best ANDA SUBZI | Spiced SCRAMBLED EGGS | ORIGINAL Mumbai Recipe
description:
#Eggs #ScrambledEggs #EasyRecipe  

Akuri, Parsi Scrambled Eggs, Spicy Scrambled Eggs, Desi Eggs, Parsi Dish, Parsi Cuisine, Irani Restaurant Breakfast, Breakfast. Eggs, Eggs Recipe, Easy Recipe, Parsi Sambar Masala, Authentic Recipe, Mumbai, Parsi Dish, Bombay

In this lockdown recipe episode, we celebrate the humble ‘anda’ in the making of an Akuri, the spicy Parsi version of scrambled eggs. Some confuse this dish with the Mumbai street food staple, ‘anda bhurji’, but the Parsi Akuri is a different dish altogether, from its nuanced spice notes, its depth of flavour, and its texture, comparable to a savoury custard. Growing up in Mumbai, this was a dish I would savour in Irani restaurants with some kadak brun pav, or in Parsi homes. I dig deep into my food memories to cook this comforting ‘eggy’ dish, perfect for breakfast or a lazy lunch. Enjoy, stay safe and happy cooking.

Ingredients

Serves 2

3 eggs
1 tbsp ghee, you could use refined oil as well.
Knob of cold butter butter for finishing
2 medium sized onions, chopped finely (roughly ½ onion per egg) 
2 medium sized tomatoes, chopped finely (roughly ½ tomato per egg)
4 to 6 garlic cloves, finely chopped
2 to 3 green chillies, finely chopped
¾ 1 tsp red chilli powder
½ tsp turmeric powder
1 tsp Parsi sambar masala (optional) The Parsi sambar masala is that special touch that adds depth of flavour to the dish. It is a concoction of chilli powder, turmeric, asafoetida, fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, peppercorn, star anise, cloves and cinnamon, ground together, and then combined with heated sesame oil). If you don’t have this, you can use any garam masala to add flavour depth.
2 to 3 tbsp coriander, chopped
Salt to taste

Please refer to the video for the method.

title: Make Super Delicious KUNDAPUR GHEE ROAST At Home | Authentic CHICKEN/ PRAWN/ VEG Ghee Roast Recipe
description:
#Kundapur #Chicken #GheeRoast  

Ghee Roast, Chicken Ghee Roast, Prawn Ghee Roast, Veg Ghee Roast, Recipe, Shetty Lunch Home, Mangalore, Kundapur, Authentic Recipe, Karnataka, Ghee, Chilli, Chicken, Kundapur Masala, Kundapur Ghee Roast, Kundapur Chicken Ghee Roast, Ghee Roast Mangalorean Style, Ghee Roast Kundapur Style

One of my all-time favourite comfort foods is the Kundapur Ghee Roast. A dish born decades ago in a tiny eatery called Shetty Lunch Home in the then sleepy hamlet of Kundapur along the South Canara coastline. Over the years, this spicy preparation has conquered palates across the country and beyond. What gives this dish its soul is the roasted Kundapur Masala, that manifests itself in the spicy, tangy, robust flavours of this preparation. Over the years, I have tasted many ghee roasts and watched its making in illustrious kitchens, including Shetty Lunch Home. This recipe, my ode to the dish and its creators, is versatile enough to be made not only with chicken, the original chicken ghee roast, but also with prawns, paneer or any veggie of your choice. Enjoy, stay safe and happy cooking.

1 kg chicken or prawn or vegetable of your choice

For the marinade:
4 to 5 tbsp yoghurt
1 to 1 ½ tsp turmeric powder
2 tbsp chilli powder
1 to 2 tsp salt (to taste)
1 tsp lemon juice/ vinegar

For the Kundapur Masala
8 dried Guntur chillies
10 dried Byadgi chillies
2 Tsp peppercorns
1 tsp cumin seeds
1/2 tsp mustard seeds
1/2 tsp fenugreek seeds
2 tbsp coriander seeds
2 tbsp thick tamarind pulp 
16 - 20 garlic cloves
Water as required

To cook:
6 to 8 tbsp ghee 
20-30 nos curry leaves
Salt as required
1 tsp jaggery
1 tsp vinegar
A pinch of coriander powder 

Please refer to the video for the method.

title: Move Over IDLIS, Tasty NUCCHINA UNDE Are Here! Steamed LENTIL DUMPLINGS | TRADITIONAL Healthy FOOD
description:
#Vegetarian  #LentilDumplings #TraditionalRecipe

Nuchinna Unde, Nuchinunde, Nucchina Unde, Nuchinunde Recipe, Steamed Lentil Dumplings, Low Carb Recipe, Majjige Huli, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra, Healthy Snack, Recipe, Wholesome, Protein Rich, Summer Recipe, Vegetarian, South Indian, Bangalore, Bengaluru

Delicious in its flavour and rich in lentil protein, the Nucchina Unde or Nuchinunde makes for a nourishing light meal if you are craving something steamed and delicious. In this recipe episode, Sreedevi makes light work of this traditional Karnataka dish and serves it alongside a comforting majjige huli, a simple yet punchy asofeotida oil, and a snacky upma version as well. These are perfect to rustle up in your kitchen, either for a satisfying lunch or an evening bite. Stay safe and happy cooking.

Ingredients to make Nucchina Unde 
Makes 20 to 25 dumplings

1 cup toor dal
1 cup Bengal gram
1 cup split green gram
1 tsp cumin seeds
1 tsp peppercorns
1 tsp turmeric powder
½ tsp asafoetida
1 cup grated fresh coconut
7 to 8 green chillies
25 to 30 curry leaves
A bunch of coriander leaves
Water, as required
Salt, to taste

title: How To Make An Authentic KARNATAKA MAJJIGE HULI | Wholesome VEGETABLE & YOGHURT CURRY |  Summer Dish
description:
#Vegetarian  #VegetableCurry #HomeRecipe

Majjige Huli, Recipe, Yoghurt, Vegetable, Curry, Ladyfinger, Authentic, Karnataka, Brahmin, Recipe, Wholesome Vegetable Curry, Summer Recipe, Vegetarian, Spicy Curry, Wholesome, Nourishing Curry, Anna Saaru, Rice And Curry, South Indian, Bangalore, Bengaluru

Summer is here, and so it’s time for a refreshing yet nourishing curry. This authentic Karnataka style Majjige Huli, a staple of Brahmin homes fits the bill. Sour, spicy and enriched with the creamy goodness of yoghurt, this easy recipe, though traditionally made with ash gourd is versatile enough to be made with a host of vegetables. Catch Sreedevi as she makes her favourite version with ladies finger before we sit down to a humble yet soul satisfying meal at our home. This is the perfect recipe to make for your loved ones, stay safe and happy cooking. 

Ingredients to make Majjige Huli
Serves 3 or 4

 250 gms ladies finger/ okra, washed and dried
1 cup fresh, grated coconut
1 ½ cup yoghurt, nicely whisked to prevent any lumps
5 to 6 green chillies
Handful of curry leaves
1 tbsp cumin seeds (jeera)
2 tbsp Bengal gram , soaked for an hour in ½ cup water
1 tbsp ginger
1 cup water
Salt to taste

For the seasoning
1 tbsp oil
1 tsp mustard seeds
10 to 12 fenugreek (methi) seeds
1 tsp turmeric powder
A pinch of asafoetida


Please refer to the video for the method.

title: Making A Warming PEPPER RASAM Of TAMIL And ANDHRA Origin | Hot, Spicy and Tangy | My Wife’s Recipe
description:
#Vegetarian  #Rasam #HomeRecipe

Rasam, Rasam Recipe, South Indian Rasam Recipe, Pepper Rasam, Tomato Rasam, Rasam Without Rasam Powder, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil, Andhra, Recipe, Vegetarian, Spicy Soup, Soup, Pepper, Tamarind, Tomato, Wellness Drink, Anna Saaru, Tilli Saaru, Rice And Curry

Hi folks, here’s the recipe to a comforting rasam that you can very easily make at home. Hot, spicy and tangy this warming broth features Tamil and Andhra influences, mirroring the ancestry of my wife, Sreedevi. This is perfect, drunk as a soup after a heavy meal, or delightfully satisfying with some steaming hot rice, a simple vegetable and a touch of pickle. We also drink it in copious amounts especially when fighting the cold, the pepper and spices in this concoction providing warming relief. Hope you enjoy this one. Stay safe and happy cooking. 

Ingredients to make Rasam

 2 medium-sized ripe tomatoes
1 bunch fresh coriander
 Curry leaves, a fistfull
2 tsp peppercorns
2 tsp cumin seed (jeera)
7 to 8 dry red chillies
9 to 10 cloves of garlic
2 tsp organic jaggery powder (optional)
1 roundel tamarind, soaked in water/ 1 tbsp tamarind pulp
1 ltr water
2 tsp salt

For seasoning
1 tbsp ghee
1 tsp mustard seeds
A pinch of asafoetida

Please refer to the video for the method.

title: I Tasted The Much Advertised BEHROUZ BIRYANI And… | Does It Live Up To Its Mythical 2000-YEAR STORY?
description:
#Biryani #StayHome #Bangalore 

Biryani Delivered Home, Lockdown Biryani, Stay Home Biryani, Behrouz Biryani, Vegetable Biryani, Subz-E-Biryani, Dum Gosht Biryani, Bhuna Chicken Biryani, Bangalore

I had heard much of Behrouz Biryani, or rather had consumed many of its slick ads touting a mythical kingdom and the story of a 2000-year-old recipe! So when the craving to indulge in some biryani in this lockdown hit me real hard, I decided to order in and put this ‘storied’ biryani to the test. Did the biryani live up to the tale, or was its advertised appeal as mythical as its story? Well, you will have to watch the video to find out. Enjoy and stay safe, folks!

#gourmetontheroad #gotrraw #athome #foodloverstv 

Subz-e-Biryani
The vegetables consisted of peas, carrots, potatoes and cauliflowers, mushy for the most part, and slathered in a rich masala. The rice though was cooked perfectly, each grain blossomed to its fullest. Rs. 286 (usd 3.7) 
6/10

Lazeez Bhuna Murg Biryani
With tonnes of masala, this isn't a biryani that will endear itself if you’re looking for something delicate. The rice is cooked well, garnished with slivers of almonds, but suspiciously tastes just like the rice in the vegetable biryani. The chicken is firm, not juicy and succulent.
Rs. 314 (usd 4.1)
5/10

Dum Gosht Biryani
With three or five juicy pieces of meat slathered in masala, this is a biryani that could feed two. The meat is soft and moist, cooked perfectly. Taste with plenty of mint raita to wash down the warmth of the spices in the masala. 
Rs. 448 (usd 5.9)
7/10


We ordered for these biryanis on a delivery app. Our total bill came up to Rs. 1098 including taxes.

title: Trying POTHICHORU, Most Popular KERALA PACKED LUNCH | Pothi Choru = Rice Bundle| Banana Leaf Lunch
description:
#Kerala #PackedLunch #Lunch  

Pothichoru, Pothi Choru, Kerala’s Most Popular Packed Lunch, Kerala Lunch, Malayali Lunch, Lunch On The Go, Banana Leaf Lunch, Vegetarian Pothichoru, Rice, Sambar, Aviyal, Fish Fry, Chicken Roast

Hi folks, a few days ago, I ordered a Pothichoru, a Kerala packed lunch, for those not in the know, Pothi = Bundle and Choru = Rice. This rice bundle  tradition, I am told, is the lunch lifeline in Kerala, where every morning the ladies of the house pack rice with the day’s curries, vegetables, fries, sides and pickles into warmed banana leaf parcels for family members to carry to homes, schools and offices. Here’s my experience of tasting a Pothichoru in Bengaluru. 
Enjoy!

title: HYGIENIC, TASTY & AFFORDABLE! Tiffin At TAAZA THINDI | Most Popular SOUTH INDIAN SNACK Destination
description:
#VegetarianBreakfast #Bangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Taaza Thindi, must-visit for its tasty south indian tiffin, hygienically prepared and affordable! Vegetarian, Masala Dosa, Plain Dose, Masala Dose, Plain Dose, Idli, Vada, Khara Baath, Kesari Baath, Chowchow Baath, Coffee, Filter Coffee, Bengaluru, Bangalore, Jayanagar, Breakfast in Bngalore

Tasty food made using quality ingredients in a kitchen that rivals the best in terms of its hygiene standards and at prices that make it affordable for everyone, these are three tenets religiously adhered to by Taaza Thindi, that have made it one of Bengaluru’s most popular South Indian tiffin destinations in a short span of only six years in a culinary landscape that’s dominated by institutions that have been around for decades. 

Food Lovers’ Editor, Kripal Amanna savours a delicious tiffin comprising of all five dishes on the menu here, but not before a detailed walk-through of this eatery that has no door separating the restaurant from the kitchen in its belief that customers should be able to see how their food is prepared. Enjoy!

Idli Vada
The idli is grainy and porous in texture allowing for the ‘runny’ chutney to seep through and imbue it with its spicy fervour. The vada exudes a near ‘biscuity’ crunch and is simple and clean in its flavours. 
Rs. 10 (usd) per idli/ vada
8.5/10

Chowchow baath
Made with bansi wheat rava, the khara baath is porridge-like in its consistency. On the palate, it exudes savoury, spicy flavours tinged with the tartness of tomato. The kesari bath is rich, in ghee, toasted cashew, raisins, and also incorporates the fruit of the season, and the spicy tinge of cloves.
Rs. 25 (usd)
8.5/10

 
Plain Dose
The dose here is not kadak (extremely crisp) but exudes a whisper of a crunch and is soft inside. Although the ghee and oil is quite evident on the fingers, its compact size renders it manageable. The dose seeks the company of the coconut chutney.
Rs. 20 (usd) 
8/10

Masala Dose 
Its golden brown crust glistens with the ghee that’s ladled over, the kempu chutney reveals itself from within. Crunch (well, almost) into this dose to taste the savoury onion flavour in the creamy potato palya, the warm tinge of of the kempu chutney. 
Rs. 25
9/10

Coffee
The perfect close to a tiffin here!
Rs. 10
8/10


ADDRESS -  Taaza Thindi, 1004, 26th Main Rd, 4th T Block East, 9th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560041; tel +91 80 4091 2277
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/tKhbVWrmJ1eGmfXS8

title: Juicy LAHM (Mutton) MANDI, 14-Dish PRAWN CURRY MEAL, KERALA | WHITE HOUSE RESTAURANT Wayanad
description:
#PopularHighwayRestaurants #Wayanad #GourmetOnTheRoad

Restaurants On Wayanad - Calicut Road. Popular Restaurants In Wayanad. White House Restaurant. Making Of Mutton Mandi. Pidi Kozhi Porichatu. White House Restaurant Wayanad Road, Puduppadi, Kozhikode Road

Although a relatively recent eatery, White House Restaurant located in Puduppadi has turned into a dining hotspot for travellers on the Wayanad-Kozhikode route. Lured by its enticing offerings that include traditional Keralan dishes cooked on wood-fired stoves and much loved Arabian dishes like the Mandi, prepared in deep rubber wood-fired brick pits, we had to stop here for a meal enroute to Kozhikode. 

Food Lovers’ Editor, Kripal Amanna relishes a 14-dish Prawn Curry Meal, a juicy Pidi Kozhi Porichathu, the Mutton Mandi of course, and a Ayakora or King Fish Fry.

TAWA FISH 
The kingfish has been cocooned in a masala with coconut milk as its base and hence the spicicing is quite gentle in its warmth. I like the crunch of the coconut flakes in the masala. 
Rs. 300 (usd 4.2)
8/10

PRAWN CURRY MEALS 
I was expecting a bowl of prawn curry and rice, but instead it came in a procession of 14 dishes packed into tiny bowls. The prawns were fresh and cooked with the head, which is where the flavour pop is! A nice touch were the drumsticks in the curry. Also enjoyed the crunch of the beans poriyal, the bitter gourd, the fish pickle and the red chilli chutney with a touch of sweetness. The paruppu payasam is the perfect end to the meal here.
Rs. 140 (usd 2)
10/10

PIDHI KOZHI PORICHATHU
A juicy bird despite its scrawny size, and served with a mutta (egg). The fried curry leaves makes for a toasty relish. One of the signature dishes here, loved the crunch of the masala that this chicken is covered in before being deep fried. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.8)
9/10

MUTTON MANDI 
cooked the traditional way in a brick-lined pit oven. The meat peels away effortlessly from the bone with a thin flavourful veil of fat. The rice is scented with the meat juices and hit of saffron. The mandi is served with a smattering of chutneys, but I preferred savouring the delicate flavours of the dish sans any condiment. 
Rs. 550 (usd 7.7) 
9/10

ADDRESS - White House Restaurant, Wayanad Road, Near Odungakadu Makham, Engapuzha, Puduppadi, Kerala 673586; tel: 0495 223 4889
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/9sxtTmoz5dBg47oP7
